Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: The location is FANTASTIC! I was travelling alone, and many of the major attractions that I wanted to see in my only 4 days were within easy walking distance. The staff - fantastic. Very helpful, down to accurate info for taxi amounts and Turkish Bath experiences (again, as a lone female travelling, very helpful). The cooking class was amazing. Rooms were clean, on the small side for my room but I was alone and perhaps had a smaller room than others. Nice garden where I had my morning coffee while deciding on itinerary for the day. This hotel was recommended to me by a previous travelling companion from U.S. who said the same things. Glad I listened. Liked it MUCH better than a large chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For What It Is!”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the Hotel upon exiting our taxi was disappointing in comparison to the Internet photos we had viewed. However, once we opened the door this changed completely! Cozy, warm lobby. Incredible staff who could not be more accommodating! Very clean nice sized room. Lovely breakfast included in a lovely sunlit restaurant with outdoor courtyard. Location could not have been better..short walk to Blue Mosque, St Sofia, Hippodrome, Grand Bazaar, lots of shops and restaurants, tram stop etc...truly a little gem and so very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.”
Reviews.Author: Heidikraut
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fantastic location on a sensible budget then I really recommend this hotel. It's a five-minute walk to the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia and everything within the old city is in easy walking distance for a reasonably fit adult. There are loads of restaurants, cafes and shops in the area. For those who like to have alcohol then it's worth checking that your restaurant does serve alcohol because many restaurants won't, particularly in sight of mosques. It's not a luxury hotel but it's clean and has everything that you need. The staff were amazingly kind and helpful. The breakfast buffet is a bit of a bun-fight but that's not the fault of the hotel but more an observation on the combination of people and buffets. The buffet is predominantly continental with a leaning towards Turkish produce which given that you're in Istanbul is pretty much what you'd expect. Fresh bread, cheeses, eggs, olives, yoghurt salad etc. Someone mentioned the hard beds which really worked for me because that's what I prefer. I slept really well apart from during the enthusiastic call to prayer early in the morning. But you're in Istanbul and never too far from a Mosque so it's an added bonus to your trip. If you have limited mobility then you should be aware that there's no lift in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly1814
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried after some reviews on here, but honestly loved this hotel. It's small and quaint and SO well placed - right behind the blue mosque. We stayed in a twin room in the eaves of the house which actually looked at the mosque. Amazing. Loved hearing the call to prayer each time. The hotel owner is very friendly and arranged an airport pick up and drop off for us at a reasonable cost. Lots of little shops and cafes nearby and of course you are in the heart of old Istanbul so everything is on your doorstep. The only downside: the beds in our room were INCREDIBLY hard. Honestly like rocks and as a result did not sleep very well. Other than that, I most definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon G
Reviews.Content: In a city full of hotel choices, this is not one to bother with! When I booked the hotel, I inquired about the condition of the rooms. I was assured that they had all been newly renovated. Not true! The carpeting in the hallway was very old, stained and dirty. The ceiling in the room had a very large water stain. The furnishings were very very old and dated. The biggest issue I had however, is how misleading the website is. I booked a triple. The picture was of three single beds. When I made the reservation, I was assured that is what I would get. What we got, however, were two single beds and a roll away bed. The roll away bed had a mattress that had absolutely no life to it. You sunk down to the bed frame. Just awful! They claimed they were full and couldn't accommodate a move. The terrace is not at all what they lead you to believe on their website either. It barely holds a table and a few chairs. I will give them credit for a very nice breakfast spread and they comped me my transportation one way to the airport for my displeasure and frustration with the room situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Kay M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sarnic with my boyfriend for 4 nights. The location is wonderful as it is right next to the blue mosque and next to everything in the old town. A cute little park is located right down the street too which you can walk through to get to the water. Very close to the Grand Bazaar and Spice market. Also easy trip to the Asia side, just a 30 Lira cab ride. We were placed in the premier part of the hotel for one night which was great, but asked to move for the remaining three nights which was a hassle. When we asked why we were put into this position, the 'concierge' if you could even call him that was extremely rude and unhelpful. He told us that the reason we had to switch because in the room we previously book a women had been sick with a stomach bug. I told the man that this was poor service and a. he should not tell paying guests this about a room they are about to move to and b. that we would appreciate it if he could either let us stay in the first room or put is in a room where someone wasn't sick the day before. He was extremely rude to us and told us basically there was nothing he could do as well as failing to make us feel comfortable for our stay. The rest of the weekend we felt awkward walking into the hotel lobby while he and his staffed starred at us without uttering a word. Aside from this and the EXTREMELY uncomfortable mattress in the second room (the first one was great!!) we had a great time and the hotel like I said is in a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Great service for the right price”
Reviews.Author: Queenkameamea
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in this hotel in late January-early February and loved it. The location is absolutely perfect and within a very pleasurable walk to most sites in the historical centre of Istanbul. Had the whether allowed, I am sure I would have also enjoyed breakfast or drinks on the terrace, which has a great view of the Bosphorus and the Ayasofya. The staff was very professional and forthcoming, going out of their way to accommodate even the smallest requests. By way of example, they negotiated a more convenient arrangement with the airport pick-up service and managed to sort out a rather inconvenient misunderstanding. The staff also even mailed me some forgotten items all the way to London, free of charge (thank you, Mehmet!). This attention to detail really goes a long way and it's actually the main factor in my decision to return to this hotel the next time I am in Istanbul. The rooms are not very big, but they are extremely comfortable. The beds have high-quality mattresses with Egyptian cotton sheets, which makes for a very restful sleep. The heating/air conditioning system is highly efficient, which is a great plus in the smouldering summers or freezing winters of Istanbul. The bathrooms facilities are basic, but clean, reliable and well-maintained, while the toiletry basket is always amply replenished. The only thing I would mention is to avoid the last room on the first floor, as it is next to the service door (which gets slammed quite a bit in the morning), as well as to the maids' room (who occasionally smoke there). I highly recommend this hotel to anyone keen on service and value. I, myself, look forward to my next stay here the next time I will be in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: asimalisyed
Reviews.Content: I recently came from Istanbul, and stayed in Sarnic, overall its a good hotel but rooms are small, staff is really good , friendly and helpful. Television is terrible, just a LCD monitor with 1000s of Turkish channels , no English and Asian channels. Breakfast was good, Location is excellent. +

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: NEJAH D
Reviews.Content: This is a nice Hotel that a liked it.You can easily walk to the Blue Mosque. Also, the staff took very good care of us, is friendly and helpful staff. Nice restaurants and shops. thanks for your hospitality. i will return to your Hotel with my friends in our next trip to Istanbul. MANY THINKS

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Maya B
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in an ideal location. You can easily walk to the Blue Mosk, Ayasofia, Topkapi Palace and de Big Bazaar. There are a lot of restaurants and shops in the area and stil the location is quiet. If you don't want to go out you can enjoy good food in the restaurant of the hotel. Breafkfast buffet with a lot of choice. Friendly and helpful staff. Good bed! Roof terras and garden. Pickup service for both Istanbul airports.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: dawagner4
Reviews.Content: Okay. Before I get into this review I want to say that I liked this hotel. Rooms Rooms are not as pictured in the pictures here, orbtiz, hotels.com, etc... They are very, very small, even by European standards. Ours was on street level with the smell of smoke from the bathhouse wafting in, which stopped us from opening the windows. Air conditioning was locked and our room was incredibly hot in November. The cleaners used a perfumy scent to mask smells in the room. No sheet between you and a "comforter" which was not washed. Bathrooms were nice. TV was horrible, but that's more a function of bad satellite service than anything else. Location was superb. I can't imagine how it could be any better. Immediately outside tourist area with low-key restaurants, market, and a short (very short) walk to the Blue Mosque,etc. . Breakfast By European breakfast standards, just okay. Included in meal and had fruit, eggs (bad), and random other cereals, etc... Staff was helpful. Everything was clean. Rather strange walk through a courtyard and kitchen to get to our room, but that was okay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the shadow of the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: Mike R
Reviews.Content: This was a great, clean boutique hotel. Staff took very good care of us, assisting in getting to hammams and other special places in Istanbul. Very affordable van to the airport make the departure seamless. The hotel is literally a few small blocks from the complex of Blue Mosque/Hippodrome/Hagia Sofia, and very close to a bazaar that was good enough that we skipped the grand. Nice restaraurants and shops (Raymaz Bros.) on the same block. Staying at Sarnic Hotel totally made our visit to Sutlanahmet walkable, which is the way to do it. The price was nice, and the hotel restaurant was a nice way to start the morning with breakfast before heading out. I was delighted that they had a public laptop in the lobby, as I did not bring mine, but using it was able to keep up (including my bank balance - lots of great shopping in the neighborhood!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location and a highly comfortable residence”
Reviews.Author: Haitham14
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing in the heart of old city. It's few minutes walk from Metro station and also close to many site seeing places. The rooms are very clean so as the sheets and towels. the staff is friendly and helpful. The breakfast is good, but it's the same plates each day and would have preferred if there were more variety. I surely recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel in a very central location”
Reviews.Author: Samsukho
Reviews.Content: Following the recommendation from tripadvisor, we book our accomodation for the stay in istanbul at this hotel. We arrive early morning in Istanbul and the staff is very helpful on our arrival, they even allowed us to check-in early and have our breakfast in that same morning (total delight for a weary traveler, after taking 13 hours flight). Though the room size kinda small but its comfortable. The hotel location is very central, Blue Mosque just a 5 minutes stroll away and there's plenty of nice food available around the hotel and they fit for budget traveler as well. I will certainly back at this hotel on our next trip to Istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff and very clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AlVel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the middle of the old district and is close to all major attractions in Istanbul. The hotel is small but cozy and quant. The rooms are not very large but enough and are very clean. You really won't be spending a lot of time in the room since there are so many places to see in Istanbul. The breakfast was good especially if you are a cheese lover.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Staff, Good breakfast, Adequate Room, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was perfect. It was a very short walk to the Blue Mosque and Palace area. It is in the old town part of Istanbul and there are lots of hotels, restaurants etc. in the vicinity. The old town sits on a hill and this hotel is very much near the top. A great starting point for those wishing to explore Istanbul. The markets were around a ten/fifteen minute walk and it was only a 20 minute walk to the river. The staff were very welcoming and friendly and could not be faulted. The breakfast took the form of a buffet and it was very good. It had a definite Turkish slant which I liked. A wide variety of foods were on offer including yoghurts, fresh fruit, eggs (boiled and scrambled), cheeses, cold meats, Turkish sausages, hot and cold tomatoes and a selection of salads. There were also cakes and breads plus jam, butter etc. Tea and Coffee were also on offer. The room was clean and functional. Fine, for a short stay busy tourist but perhaps not up to a second honeymoon or spar holiday mark. There were clean towels each day and clean bedding if you chose. Overall, the hotel offered good/great value for money. We booked our own transfers but some customers said that they got free transfers so check their site out before you book via an intermediary site. The WiFi worked very well and there was a free safe in the room. Both of these free features were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “great location, average rooms”
Reviews.Author: anneceline
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Sarnic for 4 nights for a business trip. Overall it was good, not great. It's not the first hotel i would recommend for that price range in Istanbul. - Location: great location. Right behind the blue mosque, great view of the mosque itself, easy to get around sultanahamet. - Rooms. i stayed for 3 nights in a very average room. There was some mildew in the bathroom, the bed wasnt very comfortable, the carpet had some stains on it. It felt barely clean to be honest. and very simple. no frills. Then we have to extend our stay by 1 night, and they moved me into another room facing the street. This room was MUCH nicer with hard wood floors, nicer furniture, a fresher looking coat of paint. My colleague had a nice room as well throughout his stay. So it seems to be a little bit of a hit or miss. - Service. Very good service. The hotel staff was very helpful, called us a taxi everytime we needed one, and was very accomodating when we had to stay an extra, unplanned night. - Breakfast. The food itself was very good, but i am no expert in Turkish breakfast food. It was a buffet with a lot of differnt things, most you would expect to find in a turkish breakfast: sesame bread, various dips, lots of filo pastry stuffed with cheese and other goodness. The room where the breakfast is served is not very nice howerver, it feels vaguely like a basement despite a large window opening on a garden, and a little cheap (all the furtniture is white or pastel toned). While not a bad hotel, it probably wouldn't be my first choice next time i come back to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but dont accept room 204”
Reviews.Author: Carole C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. The first night was horrendous as we were put in room 204 which is hot and overheated (even when the temperature outside was 4 degrees). We couldnt sleep we were so hot. We were moved to a much nicer room the next day. The staff were generally helpful and very pleasant but our trip was marred by the first night's experience. The staff know this is a problem and they could have done more to have aired the room before we arrived - just putting a fan on would have been helfpul.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: PorziaVerona
Reviews.Content: A great boutique hotel located oin the old part of the city, close to all the main historical attractions of Istanbul. Comfortable and cozy, perfect wi-fi connection and amazing staff! They really bent backwards to make our stay worthwhile.The GM is you and available to engage with the guests and gives you excellent tips on what to do. I was there with a friend of mine on a sightseeing trip to Istanbul, first time in the city, dind't know the property beforehand but we had a very good time and realized that we couldn't have chosen a better location. The hotel is actually divided into different properties sharing the same reception and restaurant services: Sarnic (3 star) and Sarnic Premier (4 star) we stayed at the Sarnic Premier, which I stronlgly recommend, and we'll be back!!!! . We'll definetively be back.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional!!”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: Such an amazing hotell, everyone should stay and enjoy, i stayed a weekend and i will definitley go back again. the rooms are clean staff are very friendly and food is wonderfull, the location is pretty nice aswell, the hotell looks like a traditional istanbul house so while your stay you feel like a istanbuler, enjoyed it very much

Reviews.Title: “2 night pre-cruise stay - Sarnic Hotel Istanbul - WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine G
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, amazing, exceptional!! This is the place to stay in Istanubl!! Excellent location (Sultanahmet - old town), roof top terrace with great views of the city, ocean and Blue Mosque! Great included breakfast and super staff!! We (2 couples, mid 40s) stayed at the Sarnic Botique Hotel in Istanbul for 2 nights prior to our Royal Caribbean Mediterranean cruise and it was wonderful! Right from the start - the driver from the hotel met us at the airport holding a sign with our names and took us to the hotel! We were greeted with a wonderful front desk staff who offered us a welcome drink and cake, checked us in to our rooms and we so pleasant every day - they could not do enough to help us throughout our stay. Wonderful rooms - very clean, great beds! Walking distance to everything, great restaurants across the street, walk to the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia - everything you could possibly do. Was wonderful to return to the hotel every night - you'll love this place, we sure did! There was a single girl, there for work, who we told all this information to and when we ran into her later on, she felt very safe and comfortable. On check out, the hotel driver took us to the cruise port (for a small fee) and it was perfect! This is the first time I've posted something on trip advisor but had to share this information. We loved Istanbul and the Sarnic was a big part of that!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff. Ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mltashjian
Reviews.Content: When we arrived they put us in a room with a king size bed with a twin next to it ( it was just my husband & I travelling) the bathroom was so small there was no way my husband could fit in the shower. We asked to have our room changed & they accommodated us by moving us into a smaller room with a bigger bath room (not by much) but we could manage. The carpets were dirty & the hotel needs to be updated. They are building a new hotel next door & this one seems to be falling behind in upkeep. While they say have A/C I can tell you that at night when it was really warm & we thought are ac wasn't working we were informed that they turn it off at night bc it's too loud! Ok well the windows are only an option if you dont mind getting eaten by very large mosquitos once the sun goes down. On the plus side, the hotel staff work very hard to please us, our luggage got lost & the staff at the desk worked tireless to try & get our luggage from the airport for us while we were out at sightseeing. The breakfast was ok if you didn't get there in the 1st hour most of the food was gone. The roof top restaurant was excellent and the view of the blue mosque at night is breathtaking. I think with a few changes this hotel could be perfection.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Location -- But a Warning on Room Size”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Hotel is an expensive but well-located hotel, smack in the middle of the Old City, Istanbul. Most of the city's prime attractions are within easy walking distance, as are many restaurants, safe and comfortable streets, and a great deal of activity. The ambiance of the hotel fits nicely with the surroundings, but the rooms are modern and well-appointed. Staff are helpful and very keen to assist travelers with their plans. But here is the warning. There were three of us traveling -- two adults and a ten year old. We made this clear on our reservation. We were put into a room that they called a Double/Twin, which we took from the photos of the room to mean a double bed and a single bed. We did not expect to get put into a tiny room with two single beds. The room is extremely cramped -- it would be tight for two adults -- and with three we really struggled. So, be vigilant when making your reservations, and do not be surprised if the carefully taken photographs give you the impression of a much larger room than you will find when you get here.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Dmitry S
Reviews.Content: Family operated, extremely clean and safe hotel placed in the heart of Sultanahmet district (5 minute walk to every POI). Friendly staff from owner to bellboy. I was with the group of 12 persons and it was endless transfers every day. Hotel management is highly professional and transfers was easy and comfortable. Total price for 7 rooms plus transfers was reasonable. 5 stars rating, from now, when I go to Istanbul I know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: IFigueiredo
Reviews.Content: Special and helpful staff made our stay special. Good location but unfortunately we were waked up very early in the morning with a strong sound from the mosques nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sarnic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sue6169
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed twice at this hotel and we just loved our stay there. It was situated very central in old Istanbul making our sightseeing very easy. The view from the top where you dined was superb - the Blue Mosque on one side and a view of the harbour the other - magnificent! The staff were so helpful and friendly and we made friends! A big thank you to Yasin who manned the reception at night - he was outstanding with his advice and help. The food delicious and our room lovely and big for us. Thank you to everyone at the hotel - you really made our holiday special.

Reviews.Title: “Cute & Clean”
Reviews.Author: justkappa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated near the Blue Mosque, shopping, Sophia Hague, and the tram. Nice, clean rooms in a modern style. Staff is helpful too. Breakfast is simple, but filling. If you are looking for a nice, small hotel that is clean and well-situated, this is it! And you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: “Small friendly hotel near the Blue Mosque”
Reviews.Author: terezamurray
Reviews.Content: We weren't looking for a big hotel and this one has a very friendly staff. They want to make you feel comfortable. The location is very good and is in the proximity of various worderful sites of the city. Don't stay in the rooms near the street on the back or you won't sleep for the noise enters in your room all night long. The breakfast could get more attention from the staff. We noticed 2 persons that do all the work while others keep looking and appointing things instead of helping them to serve the guests well. They can't arrive at 7:30 if the breakfast begins at 8, for the guests want to eat and go out and enjoy the city early.

Reviews.Title: “Cooking school fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Sumarshall
Reviews.Content: As a group of ten (5 couples) we enjoyed a great few hours at the Sarnic cooking school .we learnt some great Turkish recipes,participated in the preparation and then had a fabulous lunch on the rooftop . A fun holiday activity .well organized and would recommend .

Reviews.Title: “Great location, boutique hotel, clean rooms, sweet garden and rooftop, and a very friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Premando
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sarnic for a total of 4 nights in late September. This was our first time in Istanbul. At first glance the hotel appears small and in a busy area. We however realized this was a blessing. The proximity of the hotel to all the must see locations was a huge plus. And the smaller size of the hotel meant individualized care and attention for all it's guests. MEHMET the manager was very helpful and accommodating. He helped arrange transport to the airport and Taksim (the modern/party/nightlife) section of Istanbul with ease and at reasonable prices. He speaks better English than many Americans! MURAT the owner even picked us up from the airport in his new Q7 as the driver HAMOUK was not available. He's a friendly fellow with a lot to chat about. The man who holds down the fort at night, YASIN, is gracious and genuine. A true gentleman. If you want a true Istanbul experience (people, location, accommodations), this is the place to stay! I'd recommend this spot without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: lns0706
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late August and really enjoyed the hotel. Genuinely friendly staff always happy to help. Fantastic breakfast spread and the room was always cleaned to the highest standard. There is a lovely little garden to relax in. Our twin share room was a small, but the room charge was proportionate to this. We also did the cooking class with Mehmet, afterwards enjoying the lunch on the rooftop terrace enjoying brilliant views of the Blue Mosque - highly recommend doing this class (but you must book in well advance). This is my third stay in Istanbul & definitely my best accommodation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, great Istanbul experience”
Reviews.Author: octsky
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel for first visit to Istanbul. Perfect location in Sultanahmet, within walking distance to Blue Mosque, Ayia Sofia, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar. Lots of restaurants in area and if needed public transportation easy to get to. The rooms are small but comfortable. We stayed in one of the newer rooms right on the street. I was concerned it might be noisy, but that wasn't a problem as the street quieted down at a reasonable time and morning noise wasn't intrusive. Yes, you can hear the call to prayer, but that's part of the Turkish experience and should be expected. The breakfast buffet is plentiful, but not varied as other reviewers noted. Wifi in rooms and staff full of suggestions for first time city visitors. We were going to take public transportation to Taksim Square one evening for shopping and dinner but were tired from a full day of sightseeing. The hotel staff suggested one of their drivers take us over and we also arranged a time for pickup back to Sarnic later in the evening. Worked out well at a reasonable price for these weary travelers who wanted to take in all areas of this great city. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutlely Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Cerpintaxt
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at the Sarnic Hotel so that we could have a short trip to Istanbul while visiting family elsewhere in the country. The room was advertised as being a 4* boutique hotel that had been completely renovated in January 2010. We booked a comfort double room. On arrival, we were led to a small, dark room behind the reception desk that contained a double bed and a, inexplicably, and extra single bed that eliminated any remaining floor space in an alread small room. On entrance to the room we found the wardrobe full of a previous travellers clothes and their luggage still in the room. Apparently the previous occupants of the room had been moved to another room upstairs for undisclosed reasons. We soon discerned the reason why they had asked to be moved. The room had peeling wallpaper, a dirty stained carpet and black mould on the grout in the shower. There was also a large, damp and mouldy hole in the ceiling in the corner of the room. The air conditioning was broken - although no mention of this was made at the time of booking the room and, in fact, the air conditioing unit had prolapsed through the ceiling panelling slightly. The room itself overlooked the hotel generator which was attached to the external wall of the room and made an extremely loud noise all night. There was also hair in the bed linen. We appealed to the hotel desk staff on the night of arrival and they offered to move us to another room the following night. The hotel manager was apparently unavailable to speak to during the stay and no other effort was made at compensation. On the whole, the hotel staff were seemingly unconcerned and unhelpful. We left one night early. We found this to be a very unusual experience in Istanbul as normally the hotels here are extremely clean, practical and staffed by extremely friendly and helpful people. This was an unfortunately contrasting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Mike U
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Hotel is quite small and very friendly. You are greeted by very helpful receptionists who speak good English, and give you lots of tourist information. The rooms are clean and comfortable and well equipped. Breakfast was downstairs and you could eat it out in the small enclosed garden; we recommend the rooftop restaurant for evening meals, with a superb view of the Blue Mosque. I especially recommend the Turkish cooking course run by Mehmet, the proprietor, where you prepare a 4 course lunch and then eat it on the rooftop. We were made very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Service was brilliant. Hospitality was excellent. Will stay here and recommend this hotel to anyone again. Thank you”
Reviews.Author: Sharon J
Reviews.Content: Needs a few more garden furntiure for guests. Suggest lawns need cutting to make the area more tidy.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing locationâ€¦ but you will need earplugs”
Reviews.Author: vegemite1977
Reviews.Content: The hotel is walking distance to most attractions. The rooms were small but very clean and well decorated. Breakfast was ok. WiFi avail in the rooms. The manager Mehmet was very helpful and accommodating with our questions and requests. My only issue was that we were woken by the call to prayer at approx 5.30am every morning, windows were shut tight, aircon on (for white noise) but still it was as loud as if the windows were open wide. Maybe it was just our room cause, no one else seems to mention this in their reviews. In that case dont stay in 307, or bring good quality earplugs :)

Reviews.Title: “So pleased with this sweet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Tom M
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! This hotel is well situated for a touring visit of Istanbul within easy reach of major museums and Bosphorus. Excellent room with comfy beds and great shower. All very clean and dÃ©cor still looks very fresh and well maintained. I loved the location, you can get 200 meters away from Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque. The saff were so helpful in making our stay enjoyable to providing us with power adapter, information about the city and its tours. Breakfast was served in the glass-sided air-conditioned reastaurant or on the open garden. There was an excellent breakfast selection with fresh fruit,meats, cheeses, breads and cakes. We went for the Bosphorus and Princes Islands cruise which our hotel adviced us, really enjoyed of it. Sarnic Hotel is really in the center of every important sight!! And hotel is good because the administaration is good. We ll come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near the blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: MtnMan81
Reviews.Content: This is an above average place, but there are probably better in Istanbul. We found it to be a good value and well located. Service was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: princesspm
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucks. It looks NOTHING like the pictures. There are no rooms with a balcony (when we booked we asked for a room with a balcony). And its just terrible. The airconditioner didnt work. It was 35 degrees celcius outside and no AC. We had electronic fans which didnt help at all. My sister and I couldnt sleep because of the heat. The ONLY positive thing is the view from the terrace. But the food there is terrible though, and expensive. So are the alcoholic drinks. I bought a Mojito and they gave me a SHOT of Mojito for a price of about $25. Rip off. Its location is good as well. But there are better hotels. This hotel is NOT a 4 star hotel. More like 1. Any hotel is better than this. Dont book it.

Reviews.Title: “charming, good location”
Reviews.Author: danabulous
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Istanbul for the first time for five days in January 2011. I lucked out with the weather (usually snowing and freezing) and had some mid 50's temperatures and mild days. The city was fantastic and Sarnic Hotel was a great bargain in a great area. I went with a friend from Ireland who travels frequently as well. We didn't want to spend a lot and my general rule is boutique hotels for 90 or less per night. I first researched the area of Sultanehmet(sp?) and saw that it was the place to be to see a majority of sights that Istanbul has to offer in a short amount of time. The Sarnic hotel was in a great location, literally a block away from the Blue Mosque, complete with the call to prayer about 5 times a day (sometimes at 6:30 AM) which was fine with me because I thought it was lovely. We had the windows shut because it was cool out so it didn't wake my companion up, but I can imagine in the summer it may be louder. However, that was the only loud sounds, the area was quiet at night with some restaurants and bars, but nothing too touristy that create a raucous. When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted by the owner and given a much need complimentary Efes beer ( I like to think of it as the bud light of Turkey, but a lot better). He immediately got our bags to the room and pulled out several maps and tourist brochures. I was at first apprehensive, thinking "We just got here, and hes already trying to sell us something". However that was not the case. He opened up a map of the area and showed us where we were, and where all the sights were and gave us a good idea of walking distance and times to go. He then showed us all the brochures of things to do such as different tours, the Turkish baths, the dinner/dancing shows and explained the differences between all of them. There was no pressure at all and after strolling around the city with people left right and sideways trying to sell you things, it was a nice change. We ended up booking a tour from the Hotel and he arranged the pickup and everything, we literally just pointed to the one we wanted. Our room was on the smallish side, but that was due to an error I made when I was booking ( I only put one person in the room!) It was clean, the sheets were changed everyday and the bathroom was completely refurnished. I managed to peek into some of the bigger rooms and they were even more plush and newer then the one I had. Because of the timing of our trip we weren't able to go on to the roofdeck but I can imagine it boasts amazing views of the Blue Mosque and Sultanehmet at night. Also, there is a restaurant bar in the basement which is great and quiet. There were always a few older men lounging around and the staff there were very friendly and eager to help. It was nice to be able and unwind with a drink after walking the city all day or before heading out to dinner. All in all a great experience. If you are on limited time and budget I would completely suggest Sarnic. The hospitality cannot be beat. Also, there wasn't an elevator. Which was only an issue after too many efes. :)

Reviews.Title: “I wish the AC was more effective”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller23322
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was reasonable for the price and location to major attractions. It was on a busy street and hence a bit noisy. One night the water stopped coming, but was restored within 30 minutes. The AC was inadequate, and the bathroom, especially the shower stall, was a bit too small. The staff were very friendly and the hotel offered free pick up from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel - felt like family”
Reviews.Author: prounds
Reviews.Content: Loved this quaint hotel. It served us well as a central location to visit old Istanbul, all by foot, and also walked to Taksim square. The staff was friendly and very helpful, the rooms were simple but clean and comfortable, the breakfast was excellent and plentiful. We missed the cooking classes since the chef was on vacation, but didn't really effect the quality of our experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but very bad services at the reception!!”
Reviews.Author: ElisaNanu
Reviews.Content: The hotel was good, not very good, but ok. The breakfast was not so good. The location is perfect! The guy from the reception was very strange. He tryed to charge us with extra 90 Euro. There was another client at the reception with the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “The SarnÄ±c is a delightful hotel in a perfect location...”
Reviews.Author: atak06
Reviews.Content: We had the best time in pleasent hotel.I enjoyed myself here so much nd ll recomend to all..Excellent service,friendly staff,beautÄ±ful roof terrace...Thanks for memories Sweet Boutique Hotel..I would stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, and a must for food lovers”
Reviews.Author: scottbarghaan
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Turkey solo and searched high / low for a hotel that brought a good, safe location, value for the dollar, and could provide a unique experience. I received all of these in-spades at the Sarnic. The best part of the experience was the staff - notably the owner, a down to earth, friendly gentleman who also led the Turkish cooking class and his desk staff. Great location, great staff, good advice, and good food - all make for a memorable trip I am still talking about.

Reviews.Title: “I always try and go here once a year”
Reviews.Author: pshahini
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Wonderful staff. Extremely helpful. Speak excellent English. Very clean rooms. Room size excellent. Great breakfast. Nice evening meal available. Very close to the Blue Mosque and Old City. I have been going here each year for the past 7 or 8 years. I always look forward to the holiday. Last year I arrived on the wrong day! The hotel were extremely kind and fixed me up in a neighbouring hotel until my room became available...... The hotel even arranges a car to meet one at the airport. I am visiting there again in three weeks. Despite once again messing them around with dates etc, they are still as accommadating and kind as ever. Use the people's ferry to go up the Bosphorous. It costs peanuts and if you speak nicely to a few people on the ship you might get to do the whole journey with the Captain.....and find out about this really interesting stretch of water with an extremely complicated mechanism for getting all the enormous ships backwards and forwards to the Black Sea...far better than one of those wretched tourist boats!! Also take another people's ferry and go to the Islands. Get to the front of the queue and grab an putside seat for the one hour journey. No vehicles on the Islands. You can hire a bicycle and access some of the beaches off the beaten track. There's an excellent tram service. Use that to go to Taxim which is on the other side. Stay on the tram until its final destination and then take a small funicular to get to Taxim. Lots of western syle shops there. The tram terminus is where the ferries go from to the islands. Taxis are not that expensive. Sometimes I ask the hotel to get me a tame taxi and go for about 1.5 hours to the Black Sea beach. Hardly anyone there, but there are some restaurants.......although check the prices before you eat!! I will continue to visit Istanbul and stay in this lovely hotel each year as it is a wonderful holiday for me .

Reviews.Title: “We were welcomed at the airport, even after midnight (!) and brought to the hotel comfortably.”
Reviews.Author: cevir
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and comfortable, the bed excellent. So was the morning breakfast. The view from the roof terrace in the evening right onto the Blue Mosque was unforgettable. The hotel's situation right in the middle of the old town is very practical. We hope to be back soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but boutique description is stretching it.....”
Reviews.Author: NorthYorksBeerlover
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week here. Had a room in the new extension, which is fine, and has a lift (unlike the original building it seems from other reviews). The new wing is reached by going through two doors, under a fire escape, then down a narrowish outside passage. The staff were generally friendly and helpful, although the fairly hard sell on 'excursions' by the desk man on arrival was a little offputting (they did not seem very good value in retrospect - arrange these yourself like we did). The room was smallish but adequate, it had a lovely view of the Blue Mosque etc. It was newly finished and comfortable, and the shower was excellent. The windows did a good job of insulating against the street noise, apart from the early morning call to prayer, which we didnt mind. Overall, worth a stay, but calling it 'boutique is, in my opinion, streching it.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Sarnic for a lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: SuffolkLiz
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an ideal position for seeing what Istanbul has to offer. The staff are friendly and curteous and really do their best to make the stay succesful. We were greated with tea and given maps and all sorts of useful tips about our short stay in the city. Most importantly we were told it was a very safe area and indeed it was. This was important for three women. Breakfast was more than adequate, buffet style...I suggest you get to breakfast by 9am as the coffee tends to run out...they may have an updated coffee maker by the time you visit. The beds were great as we like a very firm matress and the room was clean with enough space for three adults to move around with comfort. There were plenty of fresh towels and good quality toiletries ( including hair conditioner). The hotel arranged our transport back to the airport, which was the one on the Asian side and was a drive of over an hour!! We left on a Friday at rush hour and his experience and confidence with the journey was a God Send!! Further more he was a very intersting driver and he made the journey a pleasure. He tells us that the family are investing in a nearby Sister Hotel for next season. We would certainly use any hotel that this family runs!!

Reviews.Title: “Big range in room quality”
Reviews.Author: joyee03
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights here but the first night was in Room 102 a dark hot room directly behind the reception with a window onto a storeroom full of toilet rolls; this was a small double not the 'comfortable twin' we had booked. We complained and were told we would be moved the next day. I was really upset, I am asthmatic and felt really awful. We were moved to a nice twin room on the top floor, the one we had booked and were given a bowl of fruit as recompense; I really thought that some money back would have been appropriate. This is not a cheap hotel and I don't think the staff realise how much time, effort and money goes into booking a trip and just how upsetting it is to be treated like this; it spoilt the trip without a doubt. I get fed up of the attitude that as two women you can be treated really badly and you won't make a fuss; it was clear that we would have been here for the whole trip if we had been too polite to speak out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean modern facilities, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Mary_and_Michael81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights. Chose the hotel based on Rick Steves book and Trip Advisor reviews. The bathroom was small but modern, a great shower! We shared the room with our College age son so for 3 people it was cramped and we would have liked a chair but the staff was very friendly and Helpful.The lobby very comfy and the breakfast that was included was delicious and varied every morning.The housekeeping staff did a superb job and we never came back from a day of touring to an unkempt roomThe view from the roof top was amazing though not opened in early April weathe r.The location and staff were the stars of this small cozy hotel.We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel will be staying at it again.”
Reviews.Author: drc46530
Reviews.Content: Wanted to stay at a boutique hotel for a couple of nights and I wanted to try a Turkish cooking class, so found this hotel and it was one stop shopping. Staff picked us up at the airport and took us to the hotel. The driver was cool enough to point out dolphins that he had seen jumping in the water and pull over so we could take pictures of them. Nice touch. Stayed here for two nights in late March. The location is perfect right in the Sultanahmet area. We walked all around and saw the sites. The 4:00 am call to prayer was load as there is s a mosque right down the street. This was just part of the charm and part of the experience of being in another country and culture. One morning we took the cooking class with Mehmet and this was a great experience. Mehmet does a great job in the cooking class as well as making his visitor's feel welcome and taken care of. I can't say enough great things about my experience there. The only things I would caution people on is that the stairs are a spiral staircase and might prove problematic for older travellers or those coming back from a night of having too much Raki LOL... Anyway the room was small, but if you don't like this, don't stay at a boutique hotel. The beds were a little hard, and the TV small, but I didn't travel all of that way to sleep and watch TV. Overall I loved it and would definitely consider staying here again on a return trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Friendly, Safe, and Clean.”
Reviews.Author: amante2011
Reviews.Content: I had a nice 4 nights stay with parents at the Sarnic in March. The hotel located near Blue Mosque...walking distance to the tram, Grand Bazaar, etc...Rooms are very small, only one small closet to store clothes & luggage (no dresser, no chair, only 1 bedside table), bathroom is tiny - but this is a BOUTIQUE hotel...the hotel property was adequate (as long as you do not need to spend much time in your room.) The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. This hotel is good for the first time visitors...but there are also other options available around...probably at a higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Service,”
Reviews.Author: Dsandison
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Sarnic Hotel for weekend and everything was just fabulous location, staff, and room. The hotel staff welcomed us from Airport and their great hospitality made our short weekend break unforgettable. The location is very close to all main sightseeing places in old Istanbul and easy to reach other places by Tram. I definitely recommend SarnÄ±c Hotel to Istanbul lovers. By the way I loved their Turkish cooking classThank you for everything xx D. Sandison Colchester, UK

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice, clean, helpful.”
Reviews.Author: LindenHills
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 3 day stay at the Sarnic. Well located on a nice little street, close to everything we wanted cover in our brief visit: Blue Mosque, Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar, Hamam. DIning options in this area are uninspired: lots of kebabs, mezes and just a repetitive sort of dining scene. This is no reflection of the hotel. Its speaks more to the downside of an area (sultanahmet) that is largely devoted to tourist traffic than repeat customers. The hotel is quite simple and quiets down nicely at night. Breakfasts were classic Turkish fare: olives cheese, meat, yogurt, dried fruit. Sunday assortment was a bit meager but Monday & Tuesday were bountiful. Front desk help was always gracious and kind. After hours English capability of front desk staff varies greatly. I had chosen this hotel largely so that I could attend the cooking class...it was canceled due to low attendance. I can understand the need to do this but it was a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Truly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: keylimepie0
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before choosing a hotel to stay in for our (my mother and I) 3-day Istanbul trip. A big issue for us was our luggage - we wanted an airport shuttle that could accommodate our 6 pieces of luggage. I contacted the hotel ahead of time about it - they said that they would not be able to give us free airport transport because we were not booking through their website. This was fine, I e-mailed the manager back saying that we would pay the 20 euros, and asked what other information was needed for our pick up. He replied saying someone would meet me at the exit door in the airport. After our 12h flight, we arrived in Istanbul around 6am. We came out of baggage claim and there was no person waiting for us. We waited for 30 mins, then asked information. They said they had no record of anyone coming for us. I called the hotel on a pay phone and the receptionist said that they had no record of our hotel pickup. At first he didn't seem to believe that I had reserved it, then I pulled up the email that the manager had sent me and read it word-for-word to him over the phone. He then said that we could come on another taxi service because their car was unavailable. The taxi that he suggested said that it would cost 70TL (32 euros). I complained to the receptionist about the price pointing out that it was their fault that no one was there to pick us up. The receptionist then talked to the taxi guy down to 50TL (23euros). I complained again saying this was still more than what we were supposed to pay and it seemed unfair for us to have to pay more when it wasn't our fault in the first place. He then told me that they would reimburse us the difference. I told him that I felt that if this had been any other hotel, the would offer to bring us for free to compensate for our inconvenience, he said we could talk to the manager. After arriving at the hotel, we were told that our room was not ready yet and we could go eat breakfast while we waited for our room to be ready. After waiting an hour, the manager finally finished eating breakfast and was ready to speak with us. He said that they would not be able to reimburse us for the transportation and that we had booked a single room and since we are two people, we would have to pay 20euros more per night. I pointed out that the reservation said that we would get a king size bed which was fine for the two of us; he said this was not possible and we would have to pay the extra 60euros for 3 nights. Defeated, we went to our room. After an hour in the room, it was so hot that I was sweating. We couldn't figure out how to turn down the temperature, it seemed to be centrally controlled instead of by the device in teh room. We called reception who said that they would send someone to look at it. An hour went by, no one came. I called again, different person picked up, and said they would send someone. Stlil no one. Finally, we flagged down a maid and gestured that it was too hot and she brought us a fan. It was still too hot. On our way out of the hotel, I told the reception again to please take a look at our thermostat. When we came back that night, I asked on our way up if they had looked at it; they said yes, to go up and check. It was still way too hot, but we gave up on telling them and just made do with the fan. Throughout our hotel stay, I felt rather uncomfortable whenever I was in the lobby of the hotel. I felt like the receptionists kept giving me sidelong glances, as if they needed to keep an eye on me or something. I'm not sure why this is; maybe they just don't see that many people of South Asian descent around Istanbul. I've traveled pretty extensively and have never encountered this overt type of behavior before. This part may be in my head, I just wanted to mention it in case you are not of Caucasian descent. The last incident I want to mention was the morning of our departure. I asked the receptionist (a new one that I had not seen before) if we could check out and wnated to confirm that our car would be arriving on time. He totaled the transportation cost + the cost of an extra person staying. Then, I told him that we had been told that the difference in transportation from our arrival was supposed to be reimbursed. He did not even let me finish my sentence and said "NO, this is not possible." I insisted that this agreement had already been made, and to ask the guy that had made the agreement who I saw at breakfast that morning. After he denied my claim several times, he finally called the guy and then after speaking to him said that the difference was "only 5 TL." I told him that I knew it wasn't much but it was the principle and my hard-earned money is valuable to me no matter how little it is. For the rest of the transaction, he was rather rude to me; I didn't feel like a customer at all, I felt more like he was doing me a favor by letting me stay at the hotel. He asked me 3 times if I had used the minibar, and after i said no literally 3 times, he sent the bellhop up to ask me again and to check the minibar. This receptionist then drove us to the airport himself in a van. At first I was thinking that maybe they didn't want to reimburse the money for the cab because they hired another company, but then when I realized that it was jus ttheir own van and they could have easily driven us for free as an apology for our inconveniences, this made me more upset. In conclusion, I am sad to say that I would not recommend this hotel to a friend (especialy if they are not Caucasian). I saw how the people at this hotel treated other tenants and I truly felt like there was a difference. I am not the type of person that is hypersensitive to this type of thing (as I mentioned, I have never experienced this before) so I don't think that it was in my head. I am especially inclined to think this after reading all the wonderful reviews in comparison to my disappointing experience. I just felt they didn't care about making my stay good; maybe they don't want me to recommend them to my brown friends. As far as cleanliness, location, and breakfast; these were all excellent. The issues mentioned are the only negative things I have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff at Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: withliberty
Reviews.Content: This is essentially a 3-star hotel with 4-star staff. I booked through Orbitz at an unbelievable rate during off-season ($85/night in a perfect location including breakfast). I'll start with the "needs improvement" parts, but conclude that - overall - I was very pleased with the value for the price I paid. Note that if you book through Orbitz, complimentary shuttle is not included, but is still well worth the 20 Euro. My driver was supposed to greet me holding a sign with my name. He was late by 20 minutes. I went to Turkish Airlines and they phoned the hotel, but a less seasoned traveler might be a bit more distrubed. I arrived near midnight and there was no welcome drink at this time of the night. King room has a king-sized bed, but with two twin mattresses put together. It was "extra firm." There was construction going on every morning outside my window at 8 am (no problem for me; I'm an early riser on vacation, but forget about an afternoon nap). The rooftop bar was not open during my stay even though it was the beginning of spring and I thought temperatures were perfect. Again, no fault of hotel - there isn't enough traffic to support serving a single guest. Also, I ordered something at the restaurant and was told I could not charge a beverage to my room. That seems like it would be the easiest thing in the world to coordinate. Finally, the cleaning crew left my trash there for the entire stay. Good thing I didn't order fish sandwich to go... Now for the good news - the staff is truly excellent and will ensure your stay is pleasant. Continental breakfast was satisfying, free wi-fi, location could not be beat, hot shower every morning with all the necessary toiletries, and - while I've mentioned the worst parts - none of these had any major impact on my vacation. It was more like a lot of small things that make the difference between being good and being great. If you can stay here for a good rate - book it.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Edd0Eindhoven
Reviews.Content: Sarnic hotel is just fine if you are looking for a small hotel. Staff is efficient and will do almost everything to please their guests. Rooms are small, beds are hard the bathroom / shower very small. although a bit dated it was clean. It is located strategically on a walking distance to several sights as the Aya Sophia and the Blue Mosk. The breakfast was okay. When they redo the rooms and install softer beds they would get a high rating from me.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with the service”
Reviews.Author: michaelward954
Reviews.Content: This clean, comfortable hotel is in a historic building in the heart of Sultanahmet. We were very grateful to the hotel staff who, when my son left his camera in a taxi, were most helpful in phoning the taxi rank and tracking down the driver. We got the camera back in half an hour. Thankyou Sarnic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “friendly little hotel in a perfect location for the main sights”
Reviews.Author: cycleaddict
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic had really friendly staff and we appreciated being able to book a shuttle to and from the airport for speed and ease. The room was small but well done out and the bathroom (shower room) was well equipped and newly done. Breakfast was very simple and you had to pay extra for fresh juice. However, cereal and bread and cheese was sufficient for us. The hotel really is in an ideal location, minutes to the blue mosque with a small store selling water etc. over the road and some nice bars nearby. The street is relatively quiet. The only negative was a small patch of damp in the bedroom, we were on the top floor as we'd requested a high floor room. However, you couldn't smell the damp at all and it didn't affect us. Good heating/air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in historic Sultanahmet district”
Reviews.Author: Karsiyakali2011
Reviews.Content: Nestled within the labyrinthine streets & alleys of the Sultanahmet district of Istanbul, the SarniÃ§ hotel offers a quiet & friendly atmosphere for any travel-weary tourist to wind down after a long day of sightseeing. The small boutique hotel is perfectly located- a mere stoneâ€™s throw away from the major tourist sites of Old Istanbul- Aya Sofya, the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, TopkapÄ± SarayÄ± and other cultural marvels. It is also in proximity of Istanbulâ€™s rail & metro stations- a convenient starting point for all day trips to the other districts of this enchanting city. The hotel staff is polite, cordial and ready to assist with any requests- usually by first offering a glass of the customary Turkish Ã§ay (tea). Any sought after information on museums, tours & airport transfers is quickly dealt with. The rooms are simply decorated and very clean- a nice touch is the glass jar of lokum â€˜candyâ€™ (Turkish delight) which gets refilled every day. The Turkish breakfast is served in the dining area or rooftop terrace- and is a great mix of dried figs, apricots, jams, fresh yogurt, fresh-baked bread and cold beef cuts. A traditional Turkish Coffee- prepared steaming hot, murky and strong, will give you the much-needed caffeine jolt to start your day. All in all, a great boutique hotel in a dazzling city! Ioana & Ildar Montreal, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Gracious hosts and fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: scoutjem_10
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location and breakfast every morning prepared us for a day of sightseeing. Hotel staff was very willing to help with airport transfers, restaurant, turkish bath & sightseeing recommendations and reservations. Cooking class was lots of fun and ended with a terrific meal with our host Mehmet. I wish we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Family-run gem in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: mcoci
Reviews.Content: Sarnic Hotel is in a great location, just down the hill from Sultanahmet Square, the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and many museums. It is super clean and comfortable. The delicious buffet breakfast was more than enough to get us through the day. We stayed two comfortable weeks. The staff were all helpful and friendly. We had a knowledgeable Turkish native with us, who perhaps helped us avoid some language barriers, but in general, the staff were conversant in English and very helpful in identifying sites, how to get there and when to go. A hotel car met us at the airport and we arranged for them to take us back to the airport at the end of our stay (really, really good to avoid driving in Istanbul!). Our room was in the front where we could see the endless stream of buses going up to the Sultanahmet square tourist sites. For us, it was just a short stroll. Sarnic is in the midst of an expansion project. We enjoyed checking out the progress. The view from the roof is lovely. Mary C Canada

Reviews.Title: “Excellent team for guest requirements”
Reviews.Author: MAITECuernavaca
Reviews.Content: Is a nice tipycal building in the heart of the main historic places. You can go by foot everywhere and the district is safety. Good breakfast and excellent team service, they are always trying to help you for having a nice stay, eventhough sometimes not all can understand your lenguage. If IÂ´ll return surely IÂ´ll get back Sanic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mehmet, the owner, communicates clearly to meet expectations and assure a great trip.”
Reviews.Author: KatieKate53217
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel makes it very easy to get around the historic district. Istanbul is a difficult city to navigate so it is very helpful to have a mjor site such as the Blue Mosque as a landmark close to the hotel. The hotel supplies drivers who are trustworthy to get you to distant places.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, enjoyed the cookery classes, very centrally located”
Reviews.Author: McCormacks_10
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Istanbul which exceeded all expectations. The people were so friendly and approachable. Any time we travelled by the trams (which were quiet crowded) someone stood to offer my wife a seat. We had fun with the banter with the salesmen in the Grand Bazaar and enjoyed trips down the bosporus to the Black Sea and to sea of Marmara to The Princes Islands, 2 evenings at theNardis Jazz Club and an evening of Turkish folk dancing at the cultual centre which was of a very high standard . The Sarnic felt like a home from home and a very relaxing place to stay with good modern and clean facilities. We must now experiment at home with the recipes we learned!

Reviews.Title: “Warm & Friendly - Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: FTPCGE
Reviews.Content: We were greeted curbside and helped inside. We met Mehmet at the front desk and were greeted by name. He was nice and extremely informative about things to do close to our location and looked up the weather. We signed up for a cooking class on the only rainy day in the forecast. It was an great experience. Mehmet was there as translator for the chef. It was fun cooking. After we cooked the meal we all sat down with wine and enjoyed our creations. We were given the recipes to recreate at home. There is a rooftop bar (not open because it was March) that we spent time on because it had wonderful views. Our room was nice, with a view of the Blue Mosque. Breakfast had plenty of choices. The staff were great. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone. Istanbul was fabulous and so was this hotel. I wonder Mehmet, boy or girl? Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Home Again in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Tinathetraveller
Reviews.Content: In my last review of the Sarnic Hotel I 2008, Istanbul, I called it "our second home". After a very enjoyable but exhausting trip around Turkey with Peregrine, starting and ending at the Gulhane Park Hotel I was relieved and revived to be back at the Sarnic for three nights. This time there was not only my husband and I but also a friend, who had experienced a number of unfortunate changes of hotel along the tour, mainly the Gulhane Park. Upon to return to Istanbul a call to Mehmet, the manager of the Sarnic and it was solved. We had great rooms. My friend and I had booked into a cooking class. We thoroughly enjoyed it. Not only did we learn to cook five fantastic Turkish dishes but we learnt cooking techniques transferable to other cuisines. I found a grater and spoon with holes just outside the Spice Markets like those we used in the class. And the wonderful Chef met us on the roof top and gave us rice pudding. I love staying at the Sarnic thanks to Mehmet, Ercan, Yasin and all the staff. I cannot wait to get back to the Sarnic. AND PS I said to my husband "can I take this bed home?" It was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it was”
Reviews.Author: pantagruelParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some years ago when it was run by a Dutch lady and greatly liked it, especially the roof terrace where you could have a raki or breakfast while looking out over the Blue Mosque. The new management have built an extra storey and the terrace has shrivelled to a few tables, no kitchen and a bar with no drinks. The rooms are well-equipped and clean but ours gave out on to a narrow well with no natural light. Nor is it cheap: EUR 200 rack rate for a single. Well situated between Blue Mosque and the much-underrated Little Aya Sofia: also fish restaurants at 15 min walk: don't eat locally). Free wifi. Youi can do better for cheaper. Breakfast included and OK though assorted with extras (omelettes, orange juice, Turkish coffee)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will go back”
Reviews.Author: arcticboolie
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a whole week and Mehmet and the staff were incredibly helpful before, during and after my stay. They made great suggestions about places to go and how to stay safe as a woman travelling alone. A definite highlight was the cooking class offered at the hotel. Lots of fun, learned a lot and it was great value for the money. I booked quite a ways in advance and for 7 nights, so I got a very good deal in terms of price. Will stay there again when I visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: FrenchRok
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for two nights. It was our honeymoon and this 3/4 star boutique hotel had a better 'present' awaiting us than the five star accommodations we stayed at during our honeymoon. It has a great location and I'd recommend shopping in the area as well because we got FAR better prices than the Grand Bazaar. Certainly go to the Grand Bazaar, but our experience was the prices were far, far too high there. There's a carpet and pottery/dish shop right next to the hotel where we bought many things, as well as another shop further down the road. The hotel staff were a bit pushy on the airport shuttle, but I never thought they crossed the line. At first we had a room without a view - unless you consider a brick wall a view. I didn't care because we only slept in the room but the wife asked if we could move. When we were going back at lunch time the wife realize it wasn't important but they were ready to move us and we agreed. The breakfasts were better than your typical North American continental breakfasts for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Small, cozy and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: HelenRuth98
Reviews.Content: Sarnic Hotel is perfectly located 5 minutes (really) from the door of the Blue Mosque. It is on a quiet street in a residential area. The tiny but excellent rooftop terrace has views of the Blue Mosque to the north and the water to the south. We sat on the terrace every evening with a drink and watched the freighters and cruise ships come and go. The cooking school that is offered was great fun. The rooms were efficient - beds and pillows were good, the bathroom recently renovated, a good airconditioning unit. Breakfasts in the hotel restaurant were very good. The hotel is located within a few blocks of the tram line and many restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “good location but not much else”
Reviews.Author: mrscruf
Reviews.Content: The manager Mehmet tried to sell us the bosphorus cruise and taxi transfer to the airport, which we needed in one week, right at check in. We had just got to Istanbul after a 12 hour flight from north america. We just wanted to get to the room. We said we'd think about it and after 15 minutes he gave us the room key. Two days later our room key access had been cancelled because we had not booked the transfer back to the airport. We did that and then our room key acccess was reinstated. They are building a second part to the hotel so there is a lot of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Company!”
Reviews.Author: brainbrks
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel very much, great location, just 5 min to Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia and many other historical spots. There are lot's of good restaurants the hotel. Sarnic Hotel also has a very nice rooftop restaurant overlooking the Marmara Sea and famous Blue Mosque. They mostly serve Ottoman and Turkish food. The breakfast was so nice and very various. Our room was very clean and bright. Blue Moswue is just opposite you when you look at the windows. The staff were very friendly and helpfull. I will deffinitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly and personal hotel to help you fall in love with Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: HalaK_2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights and it felt like we were staying at home, but with great, informative friends at arm's reach. The staff were always helpful and cheerful, booking taxis for us, arranging and suggesting tours within our budget, suggesting places to explore and visit. The breakfast was great and varied, the hotel is very clean and the view from the rooftop terrace is amazing. Our room also had an incredible view of the Blue Mosque. I think our only issue with the place is that Istanbul is an exhausting city to trek around in, and our room was on the 4th floor with no elevators - it gets exhausting! But we survived it, and enjoyed it, and we think the hotel is in a great location in a quaint, old part of the city, a great place to come back to at the end of a long day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Teenagers love it!”
Reviews.Author: tonto09
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Boutique Hotel lived up to all its excellent reviews! Walking distance from the sights (so long as you follow the tram lines and don't get lost!). This old part of town is atmospheric, a one-way system for traffic eases the burden of crossing the road. The restaurant (and particularly the breakfast) is very good and properly Turkish. The nearby restaurants are also excellent. This now rates as my favourite city and three nights/four days just wasn't enough. If you get lost between the Grand Bazaar and Spice bazaar join the club - you can easily find the spice Bazaar if you go to the Galeta Bridge first. Charming people. Turn left oput of the hotel and left again and go straight up to the main tramline street for the Pasha restaurant (and McDonalds with its pleasant terrace). Don't forget the Turkish Bath (dated 1777) left of the hotel. The staff loved my son's magic show! Aged 14 - the "best city and hotel so far" he said.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JEM005
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is wonderful - just a short walk from major cultural sights and close to many restaurants and shopping. From the terrace there is a view of the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque. Most important is that the staff is extremely friendly and helpful and makes you feel very welcome. The breakfast buffet is ample - I particularly liked the yogurt and the various dried fruits, not to mention the bread. Everything is very clean. They also keep you supplied with Turkish delight. I was really pleased with my stay there and would certainly stay there again if I return to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with helpful and knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: elisappa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was charming,good size room,and the staff was very knowledgable and very helpful.,creating a homely athmosphere.Location was great in relation to main sights we wanted to see,and breakfast was also good.Personally I suffered the hard bed, but my friend slept very well,so if you are dependant on a softer matrass it is not ideal. A couple of pointers to restaurant staff:Get rid of all chipped plates etc, and if you have northern european guests it is great if there is some brown bread(provided one of the days we stayed)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a superb location”
Reviews.Author: Travaller123
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic gave a warm, friendly welcome and all staff were willing to go out of their way to offer help and advice. We had a perfect view of the Blue Mosque from the room. The room was very clean, and for those who need home comforts, it's all here. The Sarnic is in a briliant location. The area is perfect for anyone wanting to visit the key attractions. Transport throughout Istanbul is easily accessed from here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location, and Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: eschultz7
Reviews.Content: As a previous reviewer stated, we grew really close to the staff at the Sarnic during the week we spent there. They were helpful, professional, and fun. When you visit a place where you know no one, it is so nice to feel that you can count on the people at your hotel to help you in any kind of situation. Also, the location is fantastic. You are in a relatively quiet area, but right near all the sights. The tram stop was also only a few blocks away, so you could easily get to other parts of the city. One note: We took the subway and tram from the airport when we arrived, but I would suggest using the Sarnic's transfer service. The sidewalks are bumpy and narrow when trying to roll luggage. We used the van service the hotel offered to go back to the airport. It was inexpensive, and Ozcan was a great tour guide during the ride. Finally, the breakfasts, which are included in the room price, were fantastic. We have stayed in many European hotels, and this breakfast was as a good as any we have had. We definitely would stay here again if we return to Istanbul and would certainly suggest it to any friends visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “The location of Sarnic is very comfortable, as it is close to sightseengs, it is safe.”
Reviews.Author: Cholpon
Reviews.Content: The staff of Sarnic hotel was extremly helpful, polite and professional. When it was the birthday of my friend the reception kindly offered to buy a cake for my friend and helped me to make a nice surprise. :)))

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Trompe_Le_Monde
Reviews.Content: The location can not be beat as it is a short walk from all the major attractions, restaurants and the tram. Service was very helpful and friendly and the rooms are basic but clean with continental breakfast included. The call to prayer from the Blue Mosque is loud, and could disturb light sleepers but would probably be an issue in many hotels. A thoroughly pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and dangerous”
Reviews.Author: Voyager1066
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel back in October for a Christmas to New Year 4-day family break for seven of us (4 grown-up offspring, eldest son's girlfriend and ourselves). We've just flown home and while the experience is fresh in my memory here are my comments: Good aspects - Great location: we were 5 minutes' walk from the Blue Mosque. Also the barman was friendly and even though the roof bar was shut, he would open it for us and serve drinks there - and it's an excellent view. Bad aspects - (a) The taxi from the airport was arranged for us specially by the hotel. It was a private booking but they then tried to include other people who were going to multiple city locations. That wasnâ€™t what we had paid for and it would have added a lot more time to our journey. We protested and they eventually relented but it was very unprofessional and somewhat embarrassing. Then the second taxi from the airport (some of us flew in a day later) was driven by a driver on crutches using a specially adapted vehicle and although we were obviously sympathetic, it was worrying especially when he spent time on the phone while driving. Then on the return trip to the airport, the driver didnâ€™t even know where the new airport (Sabiha Gokcen) was located - he didnâ€™t take the motorway despite us pointing this out to him (presumably to save the toll) and we ended up overshooting it and returning towards Istanbul. It looks to me that the hotel simply called up some low-budget drivers for this booking but for 174 euros I feel we were entitled to a much more professional taxi service. (b) We had been promised nice rooms with a view from the window but instead one of our three rooms was Room 305 at the back - very hot and looking out onto a building site and waste ground. Worse still, the heating/aircon units and the backup generator were right below the window so when the power failed (every day or so during our trip) there was an enormous noise and also diesel fumes and smoke that came in through the window. If you tried to minimise this by shutting the window the room then became very hot. It was a real Catch-22 and this sounds like the same area of the hotel as for the earlier review dated 2 Dec 2009.
