(c) When we got back to the hotel about midnight one night the power failed just as we walked in so the receptionist found an unreliable torch and walked out to the construction site to switch on the generator. We then heard a crash and a scream so we ran through to find this poor man had fallen 6 feet down into a hole in the ground left by the workmen. No other hotel staff were present so we had to stand by and help him dial for ambulance and firemen and we hung on there for about an hour till they arrived and took over. We also had to clamber over a very narrow plank to turn on the generator ourselves, following his instructions. It turned out he broke his leg in the fall and he was probably lucky that he wasnâ€™t killed by hitting his head on the concrete and glass slabs of junk out there. This construction site is absolutely lethal, the most dangerous location of its type I have ever seen. (d) We insisted that the hotel move three of our group out of Room 305 but they said that the only options would involve two smaller rooms for which they wanted to charge us several hundred more euros. There was no apology for the sub-standard room (the manager said he thought the room was just fine) and no gesture of gratitude for our help with the accident. Only by calling the Istanbul Tourist Police ([--] in case you need it) and threatening the hotel with a report to them and the Ministry of Tourism did we finally get a reduction in their proposed surcharge. To summarise: the people who run this hotel come across as friendly but they are actually only interested in making as much money from you as possible. Also their attitude to basic safety standards is simply unimaginable by any normal standards. For these reasons I would never ever return there. PS. Iâ€™ve read the hotel managementâ€™s reply to the 2 Dec 2009 complaint and I expect a similar â€œreality denialâ€� will appear here in due course.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable, safe. Very good experience.”
Reviews.Author: purewaves
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Istanbul today and we wanted to write a review. The Sarnic got positive reviews on Trip Advisor, and I'm pleased to say that for the most part the stay was very good. The location cant be beat. You are about 5-10 minutes from all the big sites, and a main tram station to go anywhere beyond that. There's heaps to do and lots of spots for a coffee, tea, or a meal. There's even a Starbucks within walking distance, great for all of you coffee drinkers. The rooms are small and simple, but comfortable. There's a flat screen TV (slim pickings on stations though), a minibar, air conditioner, etc. The bathroom had a great shower with amazing water pressure, however it did leak and make the floor wet. Just a minor gripe however; I'm sure if we mentioned it to the staff they would have taken care of it. But we returned so exhausted each day we didn't want to deal with a repair guy or potential room switch, The staff is very nice, and quite helpful. The ride to and from the airport is a great convenience, even for 20 euros. If you book via their site they will pick you up for free. They also have perks like a free breakfast and wifi with great speeds (8 megs). In the end, I would definitely stay here again if I went back to Istanbul. Recommended. Pros - Locations, cleanliness, helpful staff, free breakfast, airport transportation, rooftop bar with a nice view, free wifi. Cons - No elevator, small basic quality beds, minor electrical blackouts in the area every day we were there, the call to prayer in the morning from the Blue Mosque can be a lot if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this gem of a hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: CulturalPilgrim
Reviews.Content: We found the Sarnic fit our needs precisely. It is reasonably priced, extremely well located, a short distance from the Blue Mosque; so-called "Little Hagia Sophia" ; Hagia Sophia; the Topkapi Palace; the Archaeological Museum; the Basilica Cistern; excellent reasonable restaurants; and the tramline. The rooms are modest size, but nicely furnished. What made our stay so very pleasant was the friendly and efficient staff. The manager, Mehmet, was exceedingly helpful providing directions, making phone calls to arrange visits to less frequented sites, checking on open times, and even retrieving a hat and gloves we left at a restaurant! We highly recommend the Sarnic as well as its superb cooking class.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly Dissapointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmcn5195
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day trip to Istanbul and decided to stay the entire time at the Sarnic Hotel based on so many positive reviews. Fortunately, I decided at the last minute to move to another hotel for the last two nights in case I didn't like this one...which I didn't. It is a very small, family run place so if you're looking for a place that excels in customer service or top notch hotel service, don't stay here. This place is tiny! The lobby could hold maybe 6-8 people at any one time but nobody was ever in there. My room was a single, as I traveled alone, and it was really small. Not a big deal necessarily, except the bathroom was so small you couldn't even dry off after showering. I had to take the towel and dry off in the room. The showere door wouldn't open all the way without hitting the sink. The room was hot!! The guy who brought up my bags told me to just change the thermostat to cool and it would be fine...it wasn't. I woke up sweating throughout the night. I asked the front desk person why it was so hot and he said they had just switched the day before from cool air to hot air in all the rooms. So basically, each room does not have it's own temperature setting. I had to manage to jam a wooden clothes hanger in the window to keep it propped open so I wouldn't overheat. I also had a TV which was a cheap, old, 20 inch set which would not turn on even though I checked to make sure it was plugged in. Then there's the view. My window overlooked the back of the building which consisted of a maintenance yard surrounded by a wooden fence. I couldn't believe the view was as repulsive as it was and there was no warning by the front desk people to try and at least temper my expectations. I had seen pictures of a nice rooftop bar and restaurant but it was closed during the evenings since it was getting a little cool. However, even if it was open, there were only about 4 or 5 tables up there. They did some nice camera work on making it seem like it was a nice, open dining experience. Overall, this hotel experience for me was pretty lousy and with so many hotels to choose from in Istanbul why choose this one. Location was good but I stayed at the Pierre Loti for my final 2 days which had a very similar location and it was a lot nicer. Do not stay here. Use a travel agent if you are traveling internationally and don't have a lot of experience (like me). Oh, one last thing...I am an American who lives in an Islamic country so I'm used to hearing the loud calls to prayer 5 times a day from the minarets attached to the mosques. There are over 2,000 mosques in Istanbul and some are very, very loud especially if you're not used to it. However, in spite of this hotel I really enjoyed Istanbul. I just think it's very important that at the end of a long day of walking, shopping, and sightseeing that you should have a decent room to go back to and relax. This hotel, for me anyway, did not fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: mumanddadplus1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our 8 month old baby. The hotel is a nice hotel and we had a large family room with space for the baby to crawl around. The staff were fantastic with our child and offered a great service. The room was on the second floor. If you have a small child to carry ask for a room on this floor.

Reviews.Title: “Value!”
Reviews.Author: homerinkl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are new and very well maintained.We had a Blue Mosque view. The staffs are friendly and attentive.Breakfast was great to keep you going until lunch. Location was vet good...5 min walking to Blue Mosque,a stone away from Arasta Bazaar... The train was cool and easy for us to move around Istanbul Would recommend very much to stay at this hotel when you're in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “OK... but not sure why it's rated so highly”
Reviews.Author: plymouth
Reviews.Content: My stay was principally for business and if you need to be near the historic sites, this is a good location indeed. However, I was mystified as to why breakfast starts at 08.00 because I only managed to get one in during my stay (given early business starts). Do note that although some websites selling this hotel suggest that there is a safe and iron/ironing board in the bedroom... neither actually are. My room did not have an outside window. Outside window? Yes, it had a window on to an interior air well/"borrowed light" and would not be something that some guests could tolerate. I think this has beenmentioned before. What did amaze me was that there were only three coathangers and none could manage to hold a jacket! A single shirt on each, yes, but not a jacket. The weight pulled the hangers off their central bar (see photograph). On my last day, I requested a wake up call... which didn't happen. Having said that, nearly all of the seven staff met were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: tripdreamer_9
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic came highly recommended by a Turkish friend and I was very happy staying there. The staff were extremely personable & helpful. I even took a yummy cooking class there. The free laptop was very handy for airline checkins; the breakfasts were delicious; and the rooftop afforded a spectacular view of the harbor & the sunset. There isn't an elevator but that wasn't a problem for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: ilovesfwater
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was walking distance to most major historical sites in the old side of Istanbul. The bathoom was a bit small but the service was wonderful and staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was great. This hotel was a treat.

Reviews.Title: “I have traveled to many places and have never been happier with a hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhiney
Reviews.Content: We had heard about the hospitality of the Turkish people. We read reviews of various hotels in the Sultanahmet area. We booked late and were not able to book at either of the two hotels we had recommended to us. I have had very good results using the Trip Advisor user ratings as a guide. My wife and I were both absolutely thrilled with our stay at the Hotel Sarnic. The location is ideal, right behind the Blue Mosque out of the frenzy of the Hippodrome. It's location makes it very easy to find from anywhere in Istanbul. The decor is elegant and our room was very clean and nicely appointed. We took the cooking class our first day there and had a wonderful time. The General Manager, Mehmet, and his staff were always at the ready to accomodate our every need. There is no coubt we will stay here again when we visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Joy52
Reviews.Content: Five of us stayed for three nights in October 2009 .The staff are all so helpful and nothing is too much trouble for them.The rooms are comfortable,very clean and all within walking distance of all the cultural places of interest around Sultanahmet. I would recommend The Sarnic to anyone wanting a good value for money break in Istanbul. The daily supply of Turkish delight was very much appreciated!! If you have been out walking all day enjoying the sights and sounds of Istanbul and looking for somewhere to have dinner I would most certainly recommend the family run Pub/Restaurant three or four doors down on the same side of the road(take right from hotel).We went there twice and found the food superb and service excellent in a casual and relaxed atmosphere. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Sarnic Provides the Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: harmony5
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I had many questions about our upcoming visit to Istanbul. We found, Mehmet , the manager, to be a valuable resource who graciously and promptly responded to our various e-mails. The Sarnic proved to be more that just a place to hang our hat while touring the city over the three days in Istanbul. We experienced a personal touch that made us feel very welcomed. All of the staff proved to be very helpful and met our every need. We even had a charming employee personally assist us with manuevering about the city while returning home from his night shift. The evenings on the roof gazing upon Istanbul and the Bosporous are memorable. The hotel is perfectly situated within walking distance of the major historical sites. It was no problem that the rooms are small, because we were seldom in our room. I was pleased that the bathrooms were modern, not always so in older buildings. My friend's room was on the inside, and I prefered my corner room with more windows. Be sure to participate in the cooking class which is hands on and provides the recipes. You will have a fabulous lunch that you help prepare and accompanied with delicious wine. Considering all the amenities provided, including a hearty and tasty breakfast, you truly get a bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “The Sarnic is a special hotel where they do everything possible to insure you have a pleasant stay.”
Reviews.Author: CAWood38
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sarnic is incredible. The manager and his bother-in-law were helpful beyond belief. They not only directed us to the sights of the city, but actually walked with us to make sure we did not get lost. For three women in a strange city, this was much more than we expected. The rooms at the Sarnic are pleasant and clean and the location could not be better. We also took the cooking class which was so much fun and so informative. We came home with many recipes and many wonderful memories of Istanbul and the Sarnic Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you get the right room.”
Reviews.Author: bluecarrot
Reviews.Content: This is a charming little hotel with amazingly helpful staff and reasonable rates. That being said I must say that the rooms seemed to vary greatly and the room we stayed in the first night would not have been acceptable for all four nights. The staff was very helpful in relocating us to a newly refurbished room on the top floor and it was much nicer and cleaner. The breakfast is an interesting array of European and Turkish foods in a nice room in the basement where you can get to know the other hotel guests. Watching the sunset from the rooftop bar was one of the highlights of the trip and a must for anyone staying here. The hotel is perfectly located just a block away from the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, and the metro trains. DO NOT BOOK THE CITY TOUR THROUGH THE HOTEL. As at least one other reviewer has said, the very expensive tour takes you some interesting places, but then takes you to a rug shop where you are ushered into an upper room, cornered, and given a very hard sell for rugs. This awful experience turned into a shouting match when I decided to get up and walk out. It was quite threatening and I do not recommend anyone put themselves through this.

Reviews.Title: “Ill do it again”
Reviews.Author: guideIsrael
Reviews.Content: M A T H O V Yehuda Limo Tours over Israel [--] [--] [--] I S R A EL 60190 Dear Mehmet Emen Effendy Dear Owner ofSarnic Hotel. Shalom from Israel Plenty of guest wrote: â€¦ " how convenient is the Hotel so close toâ€¦." It is true, Sarnic Hotel is really in the center of every important sight.!! But an Hotel is good not only becauase the fact of being in a walking distance ofâ€¦ An Hotel is good because the Administration is Good, and you: Mahmet Bey have done the maximum, every one of our requests have been completely fulfill. You are a Wonderful Manager and specially a Gentleman !!!! An Hotel is good because the reception is ready to help with the hundreds questions we ask, And the receptionist was allways willing to give some new idea. An Hotel is good because the rooms are spotless clean,and the room was spotless clean. Every one of the many days we used it. Thank to the lady cleaning them !!. An Hotel is good because breakfast is plentiful, And your lady cook and your waiter [ the handyman of the Hotel ] were efficient and kind. Your Hotel is good because we get dollar value. And we got it, The price is reasonable. Thank You â€“ Thank to the Owner, who waited for us in the middle of the night in the Air port â€“ Thank to All of You wonderful good people !!! For us Israelis was a pleasure to find neighbors so kind and educated Pnina & Yehuda MATHOV Travel agt â€“ Tour Operator â€“ Tourist Guide

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: jinfizzz
Reviews.Content: Picked out the Sarnic Hotel from the Eyewitness Guide to Istanbul. We were thrilled with the location and very happy with the hotel, despite having read a couple of negative comments about it. We felt these were truly not reflective of the hotel. We were greeted by extremely friendly management and staff and welcomed in the true Turkish manner. Our timing of our visit was not brilliant due to it being Bayram and therefore everywhere was extremely busy, but the Sarnic was in an amazing location, with lovely traditional styled rooms. The guests staying at the same time as us were lovely people and we enjoyed their company too - namely the ladies from California. We would definitely recommend the Sarnic Hotel as a base for a wonderful trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location....location!”
Reviews.Author: Zoramar
Reviews.Content: Warm, welcoming, helpful and genuine staff create a wonderful atmosphere for the weary and rested traveler. The Sarnic Hotel is positioned perfectly for those who wish to be steps away from Istanbul highlights yet a short stroll back to this adorbale boutique hotel for quiet respite to recharge one's battery. Breakfast is simple but lovely, the kitchen staff are on their toes throughout their hectic morning routine providing each and every customer with exemplary attention and satisfaction. The available computer was most helpful to me during my stay. The best compliment I can bestow on this hotel is our return visit as we were booked here for six (6) days prior to leaving for Izmir and Cappadocia for another week. We were so delighted with the Sarnic Hotel upon departure that we booked with them again for our final two (2) days back in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: minmiami
Reviews.Content: The excellent location, friendly and very professional staff, the delicious breakfasts, the whitest, most absorbent and best smelling towels I've ever had, the dish full of "Turkish Delights" in your room (replenished every day!), as well as the cleanliness of the place are just a few of the "delights" of the Sarnic. What will stay with me forever is the smiles and welcoming faces of the staff. When I left I felt I was leaving behind a group of friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent friendly budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: djlmilne
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sarnic for a week, and they made sure we had a great holiday. The hotel is in an EXCELLENT location. The staff were all extremely friendly and made every effort to help us with anything. It was very clean, and they made ready our room even when we slept in! There's free internet, and the rooms are perfectly fine. No tea facilities, but there is a mini bar. And the shower will blow you away! not much space for unpacking. The breakfast was ok, nothing exciting.

Reviews.Title: “the vacation of a lifetime!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieBellingham
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Turkey with only a reservation at the Sarnic Hotel - which we had found on the internet. It turned out to be a total "gem" of a find for us. Not only is it centrally located for all the major sites, but the rooms were very clean and comfortable. Mehmet, the hotel manager, and his staff excel at customer service. Mehmet helped us plan the remainder of our vacation and then made the arrangements for us! The rest of our trip went smoothly and we enjoyed truly enjoyed the adventure of a lifetime. I would recomend the Sarnic Hotel to everyone and plan to be back to Turkey in the near future! Leslie, Bellingham, WA, USA

Reviews.Title: “Sarnic”
Reviews.Author: ijmuiden
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed in the Sarnic hotel and it was a real pleasure. After a day of hectic Istanbul it was great to have the feeling of coming home. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the roofterrace is great place to have a drink and relax. It is very central located with a beautifull vieuw on the impressive Blue Mosk. The staff is extremely helpfull and friendly, wish we were the same in Holland. We come again and we are sure going to stay in the Sarnic again. Marjan

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: 01traveller01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Istanbul, where we stayed at Sarnic hotel (pronounced Sarnich). The hotel was not a large one, which gave us the feeling of cosyness. The rooms were clean and Ok in size. The staff of the hotel were extermely helpful in getting us oriented in the city. Since we wanted to travel further in Turkey, they were kind to help us research how we can get to our further destination and made needed reservations. This was great since none of us spoke Turkish. Another pleasant thing was the hotel offered us a free pick at the airport and that was pretty cool. When we arrived in Istanbul, we could see the guy standing with the sign with our names at the exit from the luggage area. Breakfast was quite nice: mostly European continental breakfast , but also with some Turkish touch to it: feta cheese, olives and tomatoes. One night we managed to go to the bar at the top of the hotel - it's worth while going up - the view over the water is great from there. The only negative thing that I can think of is that there is no elevator in the hotel and it might be a little bit challenging for someone to go up or down with the luggage. Since we were travelling together with my 75-year old father in law, it was important for us that things were within the walking distance, and they surely were. The hotel is situated right in the middle of the historic district of Istanbul - Sultan Ahmet. It is very close to the Blue (Sultan Ahmet) Mosque and Agiya Sofiya Mosque. There is a smaller bazar, which was about 5 minutes away from the hotel, where we could shop for some carpets and beautiful turquoise jewelry. So, if I go back to Istanbul, I would defintely stay at this hotel once again. I think it was a great place and can recommend it to anyone else without any doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great service delivers good value”
Reviews.Author: blueboySingapore
Reviews.Content: Sarnic delivers good value in the end because of the effective and friendly service. Staff are really helpful in organising trips and making recommendations. The rooms are functional but clean. They are not spacious but this is common in Istanbul. Its a superb location for access to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi and Hagia Sophia. There are some good restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Nice touches like the laptop with internet access in the breakfast room. Breakfast is very good with fresh fruit and salads. Shame the roof terrace is too small for breakfast but you can eat there in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Real value for momey”
Reviews.Author: Ariebeukenoot
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel. Real value for money. Spacious rooms, very clean. Well maintaned breakfast buffet. Staff very friendly and helpfull. Beautiful views from roof terrace. Main tourist attractions within walking distance. Will come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing home from home”
Reviews.Author: nigelnhazel
Reviews.Content: We had planned a 4 night stay in istanbul and picked Sarnic 'blind' from a list of hotels on the web. What a result! Lovely clean room with huge bed all be it with 2 windows in very unusual places!!! Nice breakfast,great view of the Bosphorus from the rooftop bar.great location within a very short walk of the major attractions of the old city. But above all Mehmet and his staff were fantastic.They could not have been more helpful or friendly.(Altho they probably thought we were mad with the amount of walking we did!!!) We are going back to Istanbul in 2 years and we know where we are staying!! mehmet has even promised us one of the new 4th floor rooms!!!. Can't wait!!!! Nigel & Hazel

Reviews.Title: “Real Turkish Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: BerkshiresBarbara
Reviews.Content: I am a single traveler. As such I tend to use a bit more "radar" - I wear a wedding band; I am polite but not overly friendly. you get the picture. When I left the Sarnic I was on a first name basis with almost all the staff; one night I was invited up to a family party on the roof patio where their restaurant is (this is a family run operation) and felt very personally engaged by everyone there. Because it was a house, converted to a hotel, each room had its quirks, but all were clean and had everything necessary for a comfortable stay; and because of my schedule I stayed in 4 different ones over the course of my two visits there.

Reviews.Title: “A Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo63
Reviews.Content: My spouse & 2 friends visited primarily for the Grand Prix (boys) & sightseeing (girls). Sarnic is superbly located for all the main historical 'must see's'. The hotel is 'affordable' & provides more than adequate comfort to rest a weary head!. Comfy beds, rooms are not over large but not too pokey either. Staff are extremely helpful and Mehmet Emen was always there at the end of the phone to assist us (which was quite often - sorry Mehmet!!!), nothing was too much trouble & done with a smile. The hotel is very clean, beds made promptly, linen changed, etc. Lovely breakfast. Trips recommended & organised for us. A quiet hotel (apart from the Mosque, which we actualy liked). We will certainly be back. Istanbul is a 'Jewel' & this hotel a 'delight'.

Reviews.Title: “Top value for price charged”
Reviews.Author: WeyheWings
Reviews.Content: We, three couples, stayed a week at Sarnic. One couple knows Istanbul and some of the hotels around Sultan Ahmet and Hagia Sophia. For the the other two couple it was their first visit to Istanbul. We were very happy with Sarnic. Excellent service. The crew there go out of their way to help you. Breakfast was fine and they have a beautiful view from the terrace. They delivered what they promised. We'll be going back to Sarnic.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chanish
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, basic yet sufficient breakfast. Room was on the small side, but very good bed. Leaking shower, but cleaned up daily to good standard. Big minus: no shelves for clothes, just hanging space (a common problem in many hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JVELosAngeles_CAUSA
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic hotel is a Jewel in the middle of Sultanahmet. Great location, very clean family run small hotel. Wonderful, Helpful, Friendly Staff. No fluff. But you get plenty for your dollar. We will definitely return. JVE Los Angeles, CA USA L & F Conant San Francisco, CA USA

Reviews.Title: “Can't Be Beat”
Reviews.Author: DCMG
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sarnic for 12 nights and were thrilled to have chanced upon this gem in Istanbul's Historic District, the Sultanahmet area. We are a highly experienced, well-traveled couple who like to stay in one place for longer periods ot time. Therefore comfort , sercice and price are our 3 primary requirements, and we found them all at the Sarnic. The staff was the most accommodating, helpful, friendly and cheerful of any we've ever encountered anywhere. The more than ample breakfast of cheeses, meats, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, cereal, coffee, etc. was in a cheery, light-filled room that lent itself to our meeting fellow travelers from around the world. The hotel's location was outstanding, just minutes away from the Blue Mosque (Sultanahmet), Haghia Sophia (Haya Sophia), and the Topkapi Palace/Museum. Our room, while not overly large, was certainly adequate, and we would never have considered giving up the incredible view we had of the Blue Mosque out the 2 windows of our 3rd-floor location. In addition, we were picked up for free at the airport and delivered back there 12 days later at 4 in the morning for a very modest fee. Ercan, who mans the desk most of the day, helped us with tickets and tours, and recommended a seafood restaurant perched above the Sea of Marmara, with fabulous views and great food that was just a block and a half away. The entire staff spoke sufficient English, and I can't imagine we could have had a more pleaqsant stay anywhere else. Don and Donna Austin, Texas

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: tdybr
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights, the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Room was 401 on the front. Someone said it was noisey, a bit but quieted down after 10:30 and it was very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent. Location was fabulous we walked to so many sites and took a tour for the day on the Bosphorus as well. A few doors down is a leather store, all 4 of us had leather jackets made, excellent price and quality. Owner was extremely nice. Pizza across the street was good . We loved Instanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, homely hotel”
Reviews.Author: elhoskins
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sarnic at the beginning of May. The first night we were put in a room that we didn't request (one next to reception with no natural light) and i suspect this happened due to our late arrival (midnight) and all other rooms being taken. We however we moved the next day (I did have to ask for this) to a much better room. The hotel was lovely - very friendly people, nice reception area, nice breakfast area and very very clean (that is important to me), also a great shower too - good pressure. they cleaned our room every day and it was left immaculately. One thing I would say is that the photos on the website (not all, just some) don't correspond to the hotel we stayed in. I am not sure if things have changed since they did them? but there is no roof top restaurant that we could see attached to the hotel. There is a roof top but there is nothing up there. Breakfast is in the basement - but still nice down there. Also they didn't appear to have a cooking school any more and that was an attraction to the hotel. So don't think you are going to be able to book a cooking spot. But in a good location - close to the Blue Mosque, Hagghia Sophia and the Topaki palace. THey were happy to book tours for you and help you with anything you needed.

Reviews.Title: “"Cozy and Pleasant"”
Reviews.Author: Tenderlovinandpeace
Reviews.Content: I felt that this hotel was very cozy and plesant to stay at. The staff was always there to help me with anything that I need and the chef was amazing. I only had a couple of issues including the great flood in the bathroom with the showers, lack of outlets, and the dripping toilet. Other than that I had a really nice stay and I would recommend it to anyone. It is also very close to the main tourist spots so it is very convinient and cost efficient. I truly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Sarnic is an amazing hotel with wonderful, friendly service and a great view!”
Reviews.Author: peacestudent
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Sarnic Hotel was wonderful! They were always there to help when we needed anything. Murat, one of the owners, even accompanied us to a few meetings so we would not get lost. And, his mother, is quite possibly the best cook in Instanbul. We loved our meals, the atmosphere, and our experience there. They also have a wonderful, quite location with a terrific view on the rooftop. And, it was in walking distance to the Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, and Grand Bazaar. Their rooms are quaint and comfortable. This was my first trip to Turkey, and the Sarnic Hotel made it a very pleasant one! Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms and extremely bad service”
Reviews.Author: VJMHelsinki_Finland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Sarnic hotel for 4 nights and loved the staff and the location. Unfortunately they never mentioned the heavy traffic outside the hotel, thank god for earplugs. Something very strange happened though: one morning we were simply told that we had to change to another room. Apparently our twin room was big enough to accommodate three people and they needed a room for three. We had to pack and leave our room after breakfast, and were told to come back in the afternoon. We did, and the new room (on the 1st floor) was a disaster. More like a closet. No window outside, a dark, horrible place. We refused to accept it, which caused much irritation. According to the hotel management we had simply been given a BETTER room for the first nights, and this was an "ordinary double room". Yeah, sure. If we would've gotten that room the first night, we would've left the hotel. After loads of arguing and angry tones we got another, nicer room upstairs. Why on earth would they put us in a closet when there apparently was a room available? Beats me. No apologies for the inconvenience whatsoever. The management is truly lacking all kinds of customer service basic skills, thank god their staff makes up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service at small family run hotel within a stones throw of the blue mosque”
Reviews.Author: indolfa
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that nothing seemed too much for the staff at the Sarnic hotel, in Sultanahmet Istanbul. From arranging to have my daughter's boots repaired, to making a call in Turkish on our behalf, nothing seemed to phase them! Super location, virtually next door to the blue mosque. Clean room, a little too light and noisy being on the street side, but otherwise perfectly comfortable. Typical turkish buffet breakfast to set you up for a days sightseeing. Would have no hesitation in returning.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: sauravsimoni
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the hotel. Decent rooms, very hospitable and helpful staff. They all made me feel at home. I love their breakfast.. I will stay here only every time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel, Great Position”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo_85
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is good for anyone who is on a budget but is looking for a prime position in Istanbul. It is a simple hotel but the staff are friendly and happy to answer any questions. The location is great, just a 3minute walk to the Blue Mosque which can be seen from the hotel roof bar where breakfast is served. One way airport pickup service is also included in the price of the room as is breakfast. The only issues we had were; no hot water on our first morning, after which it worked fine, and we were not overly thrilled with the general cleanliness of the room. The carpet and interior dÃ©cor were old and warn down. All in all, thanks to the great location I would say, fairly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, rooms not so great”
Reviews.Author: Sweet412
Reviews.Content: If you want to find a good price with a great location pick Sarnic hotel. Other than that the rooms are a 2 star quality in the US standards, so if you are out and about all day and come back to the hotel just to sleep then this hotel is for you. If you are looking for amenities and 5 star service go to the four seasons. The location helped us in going to all the main attractions, we were out all day and by the time we came back we only came back to sleep. Their breakfast is ok, but there were no pastries, and it is basically the same thing everyday. their bathroom was extremely small and the shower door was so close to the toilet, it is an awkward layout. The turkish delight is good, the room bar is very expensive, we ate a small snack size of hazelnuts and pistachios and a bar of Toblerrone chocolate they charged us 36 EUR!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Joe2008Ontario
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three days in early june 2008. Excellent service. Roof top view is outstanding. Good meals. Very central to tourist attractions, safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money & Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: KillerQuine
Reviews.Content: We were in Istanbul just last week (week of Nov 24th 2008) for 5 nights during Thanksgiving and after tons of research, I chose the Sarnic Hotel. It was an excellent choice except for a particular room on the 2nd floor that had a window that would not open. This wouldn't have been a problem except that I feel hot and stuffy even during winter if I don't have moving air. On turning on the AC, only hot air was circulating, due to the central settings made for winter. Despite the hotel being full, after 2 nights, the hotel management was kind enough to accomodate us into another room which had a window that could open and better yet, on our last 2 nights - they put us in an even bigger and better room with 2 windows! I was also very pleased with the hospitality and helpfulness of the front desk and restaurant staff. The complimentary Turkish delight in the rooms was a delightful gesture of hospitality. The mini bar is well stocked. There is however, a small store just round the corner, where you can buy and stock up on bottled water etc. Breakfast is great and typically Mediterranean I assume: Fresh bread, butter, cheese, cucumber, tomatoes, olives, dried figs and apricots, cereal and boiled eggs. They also had freshly squeezed pomegranate juice and assorted pastries and cakes that were delicious! The wireless internet connection was weak, so don't expect to be able to upload all your daily pictures on facebook. You might have to wait until you get back home! We greatly enjoyed our stay overall and would definitely recommend Hotel Sarnic to our friends and family. But before booking or checking in. I would suggest trying to get a room with a window! Another tip is to contact the hotel directly and try and get a special rate if you are going to stay for more than 4-5 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for touring sites”
Reviews.Author: califpoppy
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of its ideal location,right where I wanted to see all the sites of Istanbul. The price fit in my budget and the hotel website featured good reviews. Problems started when I arrived at the airport. I had been told a driver would be there to pick me up and would be holding a sign saying he was from the hotel. Well,I arrived,after flying for 15 hours and no driver. I walked back and forth at the arrivals lounge,and never saw him. Finally,another van driver was looking for a passenger,so I accepted his offer of 25 Lira to the hotel. When I went into the lobby,I told the manager no one was waiting for me and he proceeded to contradict me. The other driver,who had brought in bags, confirmed this. I asked for a refund for my ride,no answer. Then,the room I requested on the first floor was NOT ready,at 12:00 noon. So I sat on the sofa in the lobby until it was. It was small,and the view was over a construction area,noisy from 8-6. I was promised a new room the next day,with not much better views out the window. breakfast on the terrace upstairs was six flights up,no elevator. The magnificent view,promised in the website info did not make up for the pain in my knees. The food was ok,nothing to get excited about. same menu all ten days,tomatoes,cucumbers,pastries,tea and coffee. The restaurant was closed for renovations. The good part of the stay was that all the main tourist attractions were a ten minute walk up the hill and around the corner. I could see the Blue Mosque from the terrace. The constant stream of traffic though,tour buses,cars and trucks,from morning til night,was annoying,as it is the only entrance to Sultan Ahmet square from that approach. I expected some traffic problems,but this was awful. The wonderful array of shops and restaurants made up for it though.I found a wonderful little "meyhane" where roasted meat and fish were on the menu,very good prices and service. Just across from the hotel on the other side of the street.I also found a delightful gift shop next to the restaurant,and was able to buy a lot of beautiful original art works and ceramics,and lucky enough to meet two of artists,who gave me two of their pen and ink drawings as a thank you for buying other pieces.Even though the hotel had some problems,for value and location,this place is a good choice for staying in Istanbul,a city where rooms can go for $300-400 a night in some big,impersonal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home in Istanbul - The Sarnic Hotel, Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: Tinathetraveller
Reviews.Content: My first stay at the Sarnic was in 2001 for five nights when I was on a study tour. The hotel was so lovely I had no hesitation in booking for my husband and I to stay five nights in 2008. The hotel not only lived up to my past expectations of 2001 but exceeded them. My husband was equally as happy with the Sarnic. Where should I start to provide fellow travellers with detail? In the words of real estate agents "location, location, location." From the comfortable rooftop bar you can see the busy Sea of Marmara in one direction and the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia in the other direction which are in walking distance. Also in walking distance are the Basilica Cistern, Topkapi Palace, the Archeological Museum, Grand Bazaar, The Arts and Crafts Centre, Arasta Bazaar and Cemberlitas Bath. The street Sarnic is located in has turkish carpet shops, craft shops, number of restaurants, including a wonderful Pizza and Pie Restaurant across the road. The surrounding streets are full of lovely shops and restaurants. The Sarnic is a charming hotel. It has a lovely lobby with a bookcase with travel guide books not only on Turkey and Istanbul but on neighbouring countries. Most rooms are upstairs accessed by a spiral staircase which adds to the character of the hotel. For guests who are not so nimble there are rooms behind the lobby and breakfast can be served in their room if they wish. Breakfasts are served in the rooftop restaurant and are a mix of traditional Turkish and Continental. I loved the dried Turkish figs and apricots with yoghurt, then cheese, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, eggs and bread. The bread was beautiful and fresh from the bakery. For those who prefer cereal that is also available. The cherry juice was delicious and a wonderful kick start to the day. Beautiful fresh pastries with cheese were also served (I loved these with the sweetest tomatoes you will ever eat). Our room was very comfortable, clean and roomy. The airconditioning and the mini bar both worked, an important detail for us. The bed and bath linen were fresh and of a high standard. I add these comments because when you have stayed where the bed and bath linen are shabby this becomes important. Finally, I leave the best to last - the wonderful, helpful and friendly staff of the Sarnic. Nothing was too much trouble for them. They helped us with booking our tours which were good quality tours at reasonable prices. We were so glad we booked through them our Gallipoli Tour. They were attentive and friendly all the time. When we had to leave both my husband and I were very melancholy. We wanted to return to our home and family in Australia but we had made new friends who we would miss. We now consider the Sarnic our home in Istanbul and would have no hesitation in recommending it to our family, friends and fellow travellers. We look forward to visiting our home in Istanbul sometime in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price, plain rooms, good service”
Reviews.Author: OffTheBeatenPath
Reviews.Content: The SarniÃ§ Hotel is a good, basic hotel if you want to stay near the Sultanahmet Mosque and Hagia Sophia but donâ€™t want to spend a monthâ€™s rent on a few nights at the Four Seasons. For your â‚¬90, you get about what you'd expect for that in Western Europe. Time Out Istanbul made much of the ownerâ€™s former affiliation with the Four Seasons, but don't be misled: it has rubbed off in terms of service but not in terms of the physical accommodations. The best part of the hotel is the accommodating service. They arranged for airport pickup with our reservation (free), and helped with restaurant reservations and the return trip to the airport (a reasonable â‚¬20). The manager gave a long list of restaurant and tour recommendations when we arrived, although he assumed weâ€™d done no research on Istanbul before arrival and his suggestions were skewed towards very touristy options. The other outstanding feature of the hotel is the view of the Sultanahmet Mosque from the breakfast room on the fourth floor. Breakfast itself was adequate, although a bit scaled back on Sunday. The rooms themselves are clean and have basic furnishings. (The room photos on the website are accurate.) In our room, we had really odd, small windows â€“ one at floor level and one at ceiling level. The duvet, bed, desk, and table / chairs were fine although not plush. The TV in our room appeared to be a decoy. It did not work and was never fixed while we were there (but we didn't raise a big fuss about it, either). The bathroom had all the necessities but the layout was again odd. Although it wasn't necessary to do so, they chose to put the toilet directly in front of â€“ blocking â€“ the door to the tiny shower, requiring contortions to get in and out of the shower. Overall the bathroom was clean and the tile looked relatively new although there was some mildew in the grout in the shower. In general this is not a hotel for handicapped patrons -- the bathroom would be impossible to navigate. There is no elevator and there are steps up from the street, steps from the lobby to the rooms, and the breakfast room is on the fourth floor. Avoid the rooms ending in â€œ01â€� as they are directly on the stairwell, so you hear the lobby, everyone coming and going, and all the breakfast preparations. Rooms that face on the street (like the 01 rooms) will have a fair amount of noise, as the street looks small but has trucks going by most of the night. "Wireless networkâ€� sounds good on the website, but doesnâ€™t work so well in practice. In theory it exists. You may be lucky enough to connect for two whole minutes at a time before it drops you, but it's so slow that you won't be able to download a single webpage in those two minutes. Staying in Sultanahmet is great for access to Hagia Sophia, Sultanahmet Mosque, and the Grand Bazaar. But we found we had a long ride home from dinner in BeyoÄŸlu, where we ended up most nights to avoid the mediocre, overpriced tourist places which are the only option in Sultanahmet. Some of the cab rides were an adventure, though, so we didn't mind too much.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndradeBrazil
Reviews.Content: The staff from sarnic Hotel is wonderful, we felt like we were at home! They are always helpful and smiling!

Reviews.Title: “Special accommodation in Old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SkipColumbiaMD
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic Hotel, a 16 room hotel in the heart of Old istanbul. The first thing that comes to mind from the time you walk in the door is being treated as special by everyone from Mehmet Enmen, the hotel manager to the night clerk to the housekeeping lady, No question was too small to get the full attention from the staff. The rooms were small, but nicely decorated and always clean. The breakfast which is included and provided at the rooftop cafe gave us a hearty start each day of our four day stay. Transportation arrangements were made by the manager to leave for the airport at 3:15 am by hotel van made the stay complete. Before we forget, the hotel location near the Blue Mosque and the Ayasofia, friendly neighborhood restaurants and stores, a nearby bazaar including on outstanding mosaic museum plus access to a nearby tram made everything convenient for us. We recommend the Sarnic Hotel. Gail and Joel Broida Columbia, MD

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly small hotel”
Reviews.Author: 910Critic
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic, as others have said, is highly convenient as it's very close to the old city's sights, particularly the Blue Mosque. Guests have a great view of the Mosque from the upstairs terrace. Rooms are fairly plain and bathrooms are small, but always spotlessly clean, with towels changed daily, etc. What really makes this place is the staff, led by Mehmet, the manager. Everyone is extremely friendly and you feel very well looked after as a result. Anything you want, they'll try to do. There's real attention to detail, something plenty of other grander hotels lack. The service feels very personal. I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position, Great Staff, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 23fish
Reviews.Content: The Sarnic in Istanbul lived up to all it website promised. 10 mins walk from the blue mosque and the nearest tram stop, so a brilliant position to explore Istanbul. The cookery course was well worth it, 4 hours of cooking, you join in chopping, filling and stirring - then you get to eat the results - brilliant. Nice peaceful small hotel with excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Sarnic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SirinIdaho
Reviews.Content: My husband's family visited from US July-Aug 2008 and Sarnic was an excellent place to stay for a group of 20. The staff was very friendly and went out of their ways to fulfill our needs with a personal touch and upmost hospitality. We felt at home away from home. Location is excellent, walking distance to the heart of Istanbul and many shopping places. Airport pick-ups and drop-offs made our trip a hassle free enjoyable trip. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and well furnished. Still remembering the smiling faces of staff, when I think of Istanbul, I think of Sarnic as our second home. Oznur Root USA

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ValueSeeker2
Reviews.Content: You will enjoy your stay here. The hotel is an easy stroll to the Blue Mosque area and connection to the trolley. The staff speaks good English and are very helpful before and during your trip. The room was fair sized, very clean and the bath was modern. You will enjoy a pleasant ample breakfast on their terrace overlooking the mosques and the sea. There is a computer with free internet access. Their airport pickup was flawless. Great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “good value hotel in istanbul”
Reviews.Author: guthers
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Sarnac, Sultanahmet, Istanbul. This is a small hotel just behind the Blue Mosque. It is clean, friendly and very comfortable. The price is 60 eu a night with a very healthy and substantial breakfast. The rooms are well stocked with a mini bar and free dishes of turkish delight. The staff provide essential information on local amenities and transport. Guthrie McKie London, England [-]

Reviews.Title: “Going to Istanbul? Choose the Hotel Sarnic”
Reviews.Author: Gerey
Reviews.Content: A small, welcoming hotel in the heart of IStanbul's most interesting and historical neighborhood, Sultanahmet. Efficient, clean, well run, but also wonderfully warm and hospitable. Staff is eager to be of assistence in any way possible. Knowledgeable about the City and major tourist sites,.Kudos to the staff for their graciousness, attentiveness and the respect they show their guests. Great location, good price, fine accommodations, and affable, attentive staff. I will definitely return to Hotel Sarnic.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and Friendliness at the Sarnac”
Reviews.Author: NevadaTravelsome
Reviews.Content: We have stayed four times at the Hotel Sarnac in the last two years. It is small, quiet and very well located near major attractions in Istanbul. The staff is friendly and did whatever possible to make our stays convenient. the rooms are small by US standards but have all of the typical amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Sarnic”
Reviews.Author: Natacha007
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Sarnic Hotel was marvelous! The staff and hotel owners could not have been more helpful, kind, real, and hospitable as they were. Moreover, the hotel is located in charming Sultahmet , ten minutes away from the Blue Mosque. It's truly lovely. The roof-top terrace is beautiful and it is indeed and enchanting and quiet area to have breakfast, or read, or relax... The rooms are lovely, although a bit simple... Al in all, a marvelous hotel, full of family charm. We recommend it whole-heartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Good place & location for a visit”
Reviews.Author: Bodensee02
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 6 nights end of June 2008. Most descriptions published at Tripadvisor before were matching the reality. Hotel is nice, clean and in a perfect spot for all major sightseeing highlights of Istanbul. There are plenty of restaurants with roof-top terraces around (e.g. Doy-Doy around the corner -nice view) where you can get a good dinner for 15 Lira per head. We got a pick-up from the airport for free (due to the length of our stay) that worked well even though our flight was delayed by over an hour - going back we went also with them (20 Euro). The disadvantages are the size of the room (it is impossible to unpack the suitcase as the wardrobe has only a view hangers and no shelfes), where it is difficult to place the suitcase - but it is perfect if you are looking only for a bed to sleep-in and not a room to stay-in. The breakfast is autenthic, but after 3 nights we would have appreciated a little more variety. Also currently is a construction right next to the hotel and also opposite the hotel. It didn't affect us as we got up always around 9, but be aware that you might have some noise starting around at this time in the morning. Also a nap in the afternoon might be impacted by construction noise. We also got recommendations for tours and restaurants from the hotel. They are all very touristic and high priced and can be done by yourself - e.g. went to a recommended fish restaurant were we paid 40 Euro per head - food and service was really excellent, but compared to other good food for 7-10 Euro per Head a little too much. To summarize it in one sentence: The hotel is a good deal for a visit to Istanbul, knowing that you get a clean, but small room close to the main attractions and in walking distance to the Tramway that brings you to all other places in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeterMajella
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights(Jun2008). Perfect location for seeing Istanbul. Nice clean hotel, room cleaned and towels changed daily. Staff are first class very friendly and obliging. Anything you wanted could be done. Great recommendations for eating out. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, breakfast so-so”
Reviews.Author: reprof
Reviews.Content: Excellent location: pleasant 5-min walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Topkapi Palace, museums. Generally helpful staff. Rooms a bit small but neat and clean; some on airshafts are dark. Still, good value for money. Breakfast is mediocre, as are other meals (well-rated restaurant of previous owner is now closed). Many small, inexpensive restaurants in neighborhood. Small irritations that could be easily fixed: cheap hangers with worn plastic sockets tend to dump clothes on closet floor, and single computer available to guests has difficult-to-read 15 inch CRT monitor and a keyboard that does not always match the characters that appear on the screen.

Reviews.Title: “nice but impossible to sleep”
Reviews.Author: jmwb
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location, staff are friendly and helpful, BUT: Air conditioning is a waste of time so room is stuffy. Of course you can open window but there is traffic up the street into the small hours. Even with window closed it is still noisy. And then there is the mosque call at 4.30AM. And then there is construction next door. I was woken one night at 1AM by truck reversing next to my window with shouting driver then unloading of cement bags until 2AM. OK they don't do this every night. So I got about 2-3 hours of sleep on average. If you like to sleep, and to do it in a cool, dark, quiet hotel room go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ioanna72
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 4-night stay in Istanbul. The hotel was great, very convenient location, clean rooms, and last but not least staff was friendly and helpful with their advice and information on Istanbul. I surely recommend it. Eva

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Instanbul trip with great service”
Reviews.Author: jia71
Reviews.Content: A tremdendous atmosphere with a great staff! We enjoyed the hospitality and the friendly mood. Great information about the surroundings and recommendations of restaurants and shops. We would love to come back! //Bengt and Annika from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and simple small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Digbyzinho
Reviews.Content: Stayed there a couple of days. If you need a place well located just for sleep thats the place. But they dont provide much comfort at all. The room is very small and breakfest is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place!”
Reviews.Author: simba432
Reviews.Content: This is such a convenient location! Great staff, service and fabulous food. I will never stay anywhere else in Istanbul - this is a perfect place.
